Title: Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst to join our Consumer product tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by leveraging data to provide actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Singapore and Berlin, working closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise. This particular role is based in Berlin.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Experimentation: Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests with a strong emphasis on statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation and accurate impact measurement. A deep understanding of statistical techniques is required for all our experiment analyses.
Product OKRs & Metrics: Define what 'good' looks like by setting up a product metric framework and quarterly OKRs.
Tracking & QA: Own the tracking definition and work with various delivery hero brands to improve the reliability of user behaviour tracking for our discovery tools
ETL & Reporting: Building data pipelines and self-service dashboards.
Exploratory Analysis: Drawing insights from data to drive product strategy & roadmap.
Contribute to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge shares, workflow optimisations, hiring, onboarding of talent etc


Qualifications


5+ years experience in the analytics space in rapidly growing and dynamic environments, ideally with a broad mission scope or several stakeholders
Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).


Nice to have:


Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Intern Energy Data Analyst
Description:
About us:

Thermosphr is one of the most exciting ClimateTech/PropTech startups in Europe, backed and recently funded by top European investors. Our goal is to reduce energy consumption in commercial buildings. We help real estate players reduce their carbon footprint by integrating our state-of-the-art optimization software to control buildings in real time. With over 30% saved per building, we make ESG more than just vain words with tangible results in GWh and tons of CO2. We love our mission and we will do what it takes to have a positive impact on the planet by continuously developing the smartest innovations.




What you will do:

To support our ambitious growth plans, we are currently looking for an Intern Energy Data Analyst to join our team in our Berlin office for a minimum of 5 months. There is a possibility of extension to a year, with 5 or 6 months spent as well in our Paris office.

You will be part of the Operations department and take on a cross-functional role combining data analysis, project management, and Ô¨Ånding the smartest ideas to save energy. As an Intern Energy Data Analyst, you will work closely with our engineering team to ensure our software is tailor-made to our clients‚Äô needs.

Learn the latest building modeling techniques and implement them in existing projects, including model predictive controls,
Develop and implement control algorithms to optimize energy efÔ¨Åciencies,
Continuously improve operations processes for maximum performance,
Analyze and interpret building data and make recommendations for action,
Create, monitor and update dashboards and reports for the operations team using BI tools,
Gather, summarize and accurately track KPIs on portfolio performance, communicate key Ô¨Åndings and recommendations to relevant internal and external stakeholders,
You may also have to work with other departments, giving you a more complete view of the company




What you bring:

You are currently enrolled in a Masters degree in mechanical, energy, electrical engineering, or similar Ô¨Åeld,
You must do an internship as part of your curriculum,
You love numbers and building solid and reliable models out of them,
You are willing to understand complex technical systems
You have a keen interest in innovation, energy and the environment
You are ready to share your proactive and positive attitude with your colleagues
You have strong communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Your English is Ô¨Çuent. Any other European language is a plus.




What we offer:

A valid question in a competitive market for the best talent!

We are all on a mission that involves boundless curiosity and unlimited learning, tackling challenges and making a difference, thinking outside the box and making things happen. At the end of the day, we all have the same mission: to make buildings sustainable and Thermosphr successful!




What you can expect:

A fast-growing green tech startup where you can take on responsibility from day one
A highly skilled and experience team in engineering and business Ô¨Åelds (NUS, NASA, HEC Paris, ESCP, FU Berlin)
A positive international culture with regular team events and get-togethers
A team that wants to make the world a more climate-friendly place.




We'll take you on a unique journey with great people constantly learning and sharing knowledge , and determined to make the world a better place. Our product is extraordinary and will change long-established standards and the way of thinking about real estate.

We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Change the way the world travels

Be part of the GetYourGuide journey and connect people with unforgettable travel experiences worldwide. Since 2009, millions of travelers have booked unique activities with us in over 12,000 cities. Our headquarters in Berlin is supported by 16 other local offices across the globe.

Ready to join a diverse community of over 850 fellow explorers dedicated to revolutionizing the travel experience industry? Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department‚Äôs mission is to enable the Marketing organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics team whose objective is to help our marketing scale our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. This is a very strategic position within the team as the Analyst will look at solving cross-channel problems in order to accelerate our growth. This means for example addressing the best strategy to grow our mid-funnel spend and understanding the behaviour of our repeat audiences.

Your mission


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Propose and defend strategic recommendations to our top marketing leads
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Setup and analyse marketing experiments to drive strategic decision making
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Your toolkit


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing, especially data-driven platforms such as Google Ads and Meta.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


What Sets You Apart


A track record in solving marketing and growth challenges and influencing decisions/driving business results
Experience in understanding and modelling marketing journeys
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We want your journey with us to be extraordinary


Here‚Äôs how you can expect us to commit to you and your growth.
Annual personal growth budget and mentorship programs for continuous learning and development
Work from anywhere in the world for 40 days per year
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Opportunities to collaborate and socialize with team members through quarterly team events and yearly company-wide events
Monthly transportation and fitness budget
Discounts for you, your friends, and family on GetYourGuide activities
Language reimbursement program
Health and wellness benefits


And more‚Ä¶

How to apply

Submit your CV/resume in English using the form below. For tips and insights into our hiring process and culture, check out ‚Äòhow we hire‚Äô and ‚Äòlife at GetYourGuide‚Äô. If you have any further questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch at jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì HR-Controlling & Systeme (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen im Team Human Resources ‚Äì dem Herz¬≠schlag unseres Unter¬≠nehmens

Bei uns, einem traditions¬≠reichen Handwerks¬≠betrieb mit einem starken famili√§ren Zusammen¬≠halt, steht der Mensch im Mittel¬≠punkt. Unser HR-Team besteht aus f√ºnf spezialisierten Ab¬≠teilungen, die Hand in Hand arbeiten, um das Beste f√ºr unsere Mitarbeitenden zu erreichen: Personal¬≠ent¬≠wicklung, Recruiting, Aus¬≠bildung, Payroll & Administration sowie HR Business Partnering.

Ihre Zukunft bei uns: Struktur. Strategie. Wirkung. Sie sind zahlenaffin, denken systemisch und haben Lust, eine sich dynamisch entwickelnde HR-Organisation mitzugestalten? Dann werden Sie Teil unseres Teams und √ºbernehmen Sie eine Schl√ºsselrolle!

Sie analysieren unsere Personal¬≠daten, um Potenziale auf¬≠zudecken und daraus Ma√ü¬≠nahmen f√ºr eine verbesserte und effektivere Daten¬≠qualit√§t ab¬≠zuleiten

Sie gestalten aktiv unsere HR-Struktur mit, vom Aufbau eines HR-Daten¬≠modells √ºber die Weiter¬≠entwicklung der Gehalts¬≠cluster bis hin zu einer modernen Verg√ºtungs¬≠struktur

Title: Staff Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.


Qualifications


9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:

  • Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
  • Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
  • Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
  • Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
  • Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
  • Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
  • Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.

Qualifications

  • 9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
  • Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
  • Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
  • Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
  • Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
  • Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
  • Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
  • Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
  • Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst, Client Onboarding
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What We Offer


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About Us

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

They heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Manage and upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company‚Äôs vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Your growth matters: Clear development paths, an annual & flexible learning budget, and real trust in your ideas.
Work the way that works for you: Remote, from our Berlin office, or hybrid - you decide where you‚Äôre most productive.
Time for yourself: 30 vacation days, flexible working hours, and a work culture that values focus time and supports your productivity.
State-of-the-art equipment : A MacBook & Co. to help you get started quickly
On top of that, we support in your Benefits: Urban Sports Club membership, the Deutschlandticket, a company pension plan, and more.
Team spirit that sticks: Offsites, regular team events, and honest, transparent communication on equal footing.
Be yourself: Diversity makes us stronger ‚Äì no matter where you‚Äôre from, how you identify, or where you are in life.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker ‚Äì you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.
Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics) to join our Analytics team and shape the future of data strategy, experimentation, and impact at Delivery Hero.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. In the Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Staff Product Analyst, you‚Äôll work across multiple squads, domains, and functions within a tribe to drive end-to-end analytics excellence. You‚Äôll partner with stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Data to build impactful solutions, mentor colleagues, and help define the strategic direction of analytics across the organization. You will not only bring deep technical and business expertise to your tribe, but also champion innovation, collaboration, and quality at scale.

This is your opportunity to join a passionate, high-impact team and influence how we use data to make decisions that shape the future of local delivery.

Your mission:


Own problem-solving and solution design for highly complex business and technical challenges, balancing speed and quality.
Align product analytics lifecycle practices with business goals ‚Äì from scoping and data tracking design to data curation, analysis, visualization, and stakeholder alignment.
Lead experimentation strategy and execution across squads, guiding engineering and data science partners on implementation, tracking, and interpretation.
Define and maintain domain- and tribe-level metrics and KPIs, and ensure adoption of scalable, insightful dashboards.
Drive forward scalable analytics infrastructure, build technical capabilities, and set standards for data quality and insight generation.
Provide guidance and mentorship to other analysts, fostering a culture of knowledge-sharing and technical excellence.


Qualifications


6+ years of experience as a Product Analyst, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar role, preferably in fast-paced tech or internet companies.
Proven ability to lead technically complex and high-impact projects with autonomy.
Expert SQL skills and practical experience with large-scale data platforms (e.g., BigQuery).
Solid Python skills (for analytics and automation use cases).
Experience in applied statistics and designing and guiding complex A/B testing strategies
Proven track record in building scalable, user-centric dashboards and reporting tools (Tableau or similar).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities; capable of translating business goals into analytics roadmaps.
Deep understanding of product development and business strategy, with experience aligning analytics to strategic outcomes.
Demonstrated mentorship and leadership capabilities within data/analytics functions.
Self-directed, highly versatile, and solution-oriented mindset.


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow or similar orchestration tools.
Familiarity with Git and version control for analytics workflows.
Experience contributing to analytics infrastructure and self-service tooling.
Thought leadership in the field of analytics (e.g., talks, papers, forums).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders)
Description:
At Zalando, we believe that an article that doesn‚Äôt fit well is the wrong article for our customers. As a Senior Data Analyst in the Size & Fit team, you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers‚Äô preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Engineering and Applied Science team and act as a bridge to Product, Business. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business, and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando. Would you like to bring in your skills to shape a great experience for millions of customers when buying clothes online?

About Size & Fit

At Zalando, we deeply understand that Size Matters . We are excited to use our unique and large article and customer datasets to tackle this challenge using ML and Computer Vision techniques.

You will join our multidisciplinary Zurich & Berlin-based Size and Fit Team, composed of Machine Learning Researchers, Software Engineers, Designers, Product and Business Managers from 30+ different nationalities. We provide advice on customer size and fit choices and conduct focused experiments using emerging technologies to solve the challenges.

You will take on this complex and important topic working side by side with our Product Specialists and Applied Scientists. We have great problems to solve, a huge customer base to impact, and we are a team that loves to have fun. 'Size and Fit' is a human topic. We use machines to help solve our customers‚Äô challenges. But we never forget‚Äîsize and fit success is defined by how customers feel when they wear fashion.


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring your business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory and quantitative analyses. You can translate metrics from algorithmic and data products into actionable business insights. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Engineering team and the Product team. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Engineering, Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a proven track record of 5+ experience as a Data Analyst or sim ilar role. A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background, including, but not limited to, Python, Spark, and Google Big Query. Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, processing, exploration and analysis. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Strong communication to convince technical and non-technical audiences with the insights you generate and compelling data-driven storytelling that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge, and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes, and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Senior Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Consumer product tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by leveraging data to provide actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Singapore and Berlin, working closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise. This particular role is based in Berlin.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Experimentation: Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests with a strong emphasis on statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation and accurate impact measurement. A deep understanding of statistical techniques is required for all our experiment analyses.
Product OKRs & Metrics: Define what 'good' looks like by setting up a product metric framework and quarterly OKRs.
Tracking & QA: Own the tracking definition and work with various delivery hero brands to improve the reliability of user behaviour tracking for our discovery tools
ETL & Reporting: Building data pipelines and self-service dashboards.
Exploratory Analysis: Drawing insights from data to drive product strategy & roadmap.
Contribute to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge shares, workflow optimisations, hiring, onboarding of talent etc


Qualifications


7+ years experience in the analytics space in rapidly growing and dynamic environments, ideally with a broad mission scope or several stakeholders
Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).


Nice to have:


Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst, Client Experience
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills in structured and unstructured data (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
A self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What We Offer


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About Us

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
Show more

After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders) AS
Description:
At Zalando, we believe that an article that doesn‚Äôt fit well is the wrong article for our customers. As a Senior Data Analyst in the Size & Fit team, you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers‚Äô preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Applied Science team and act as a bridge to Product, Business, and Engineering. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business, and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando. Would you like to bring in your skills to shape a great experience for millions of customers when buying clothes online?

About Size & Fit

At Zalando, we deeply understand that Size Matters . We are excited to use our unique and large article and customer datasets to tackle this challenge using ML and Computer Vision techniques.

You will join our multidisciplinary Zurich & Berlin-based Size and Fit Team, composed of Machine Learning Researchers, Software Engineers, Designers, Product and Business Managers from 30+ different nationalities. We provide advice on customer size and fit choices and conduct focused experiments using emerging technologies to solve the challenges.

You will take on this complex and important topic working side by side with our Product Specialists and Applied Scientists. We have great problems to solve, a huge customer base to impact, and we are a team that loves to have fun. 'Size and Fit' is a human topic. We use machines to help solve our customers‚Äô challenges. But we never forget‚Äîsize and fit success is defined by how customers feel when they wear fashion.


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring your business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory, and quantitative analyses. You can translate metrics from algorithmic and data products into actionable business insights. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Applied Science team and the Product team. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a proven track record of 5+ experience as a Data Analyst or similar role. A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background, including, but not limited to, Python and Spark. Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, exploration and analysis. Advanced statistical testing skills. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Strong communication to convince technical and non-technical audiences with the insights you generate and compelling data-driven storytelling that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge, and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes, and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
About HireShire




HireShire is a forward-thinking staffing and talent acquisition platform that helps top organizations discover exceptional talent. As part of our expansion into the Data Analytics vertical, we‚Äôre inviting analytical, detail-oriented, and passionate individuals to join our Data Analytics Internship Cohort




Role Overview




As a Data Analytics Intern at HireShire, you will support our analytics and business intelligence teams in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data to drive insights across our HR-tech ecosystem. This is an opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with real-world datasets, building dashboards, and generating reports that support decision-making in a fast-growing tech environment.




Key Responsibilities




Assist in data cleaning, preprocessing, and validation for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies
Build interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel
Work with SQL databases to extract and manipulate structured data
Contribute to predictive modeling and statistical analysis under mentor guidance
Research and apply best practices in data visualization and storytelling
Document workflows, maintain datasets, and ensure data integrity for ongoing projects




Requirements




Currently pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, IT, or related fields
Strong understanding of statistics, data wrangling, and visualization concepts
Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and familiarity with SQL
Knowledge of Python (libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn) or R
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently in a remote setup




Nice to Have (Bonus)




Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Exposure to machine learning basics (scikit-learn, regression, clustering, etc.)
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) for data storage/analysis
Participation in data hackathons, Kaggle competitions, or analytics clubs
Certifications like Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Data Analyst Associate, or similar




What You‚Äôll Get




Real-time exposure to data analytics projects within a tech-driven product environment
Hands-on training in EDA, data visualization, and BI dashboarding
1:1 mentorship from experienced data professionals & exclusive learning resources
Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion
Opportunity for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) at HireShire or with our client organizations




Hiring Process




Online Application
Resume + short write-up on your data analytics interests/projects
Analytics Aptitude Test
MCQ + case-based assessment on statistics, SQL, and data interpretation
Technical Interview
Live discussion around datasets, visualization, and problem-solving approaches
Managerial Interview
Assess motivation, culture fit, communication skills
Offer
Formal internship offer with stipend details & role expectations
Onboarding
Access provisioning, training roadmap & project kickoff




Stipend




European Union : Minimum ‚Ç¨13 /hr (in accordance with European Union federal & state minimum wage guidelines for interns), with potential increment based on interview scores and skill assessment

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: For Life Produktions- und Vertriebsgesellschaft f√ºr Heil- und Hilfsmittel mbH
Description:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.




Your Tasks:

Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative ‚Äî including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives




Your Profile:

2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
Strong stakeholder management skills ‚Äî able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric ‚Äî Microsoft‚Äôs unified platform for analytics and BI
Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus




Our Benefits:

Meaningful work ‚Äì Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.
Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer) to join the Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-10 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalogue for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject, (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL and Python skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)

Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects; proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes. Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Nice to have: Experience with Airflow, experience with A/B testings and applied statistics and experience with using data lakes/data marts

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Supply Analytics
Description:
Change the way the world travels

Be part of the GetYourGuide journey and connect people with unforgettable travel experiences worldwide. Since 2009, millions of travelers have booked unique activities with us in over 12,000 cities. Our headquarters in Berlin is supported by 16 other local offices across the globe.

Ready to join a diverse community of over 850 fellow explorers dedicated to revolutionizing the travel experience industry? Check out our careers site to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

Your mission


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Your toolkit


6+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


What Sets You Apart


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We want your journey with us to be extraordinary

Here‚Äôs how you can expect us to commit to you and your growth.


Annual personal growth budget and mentorship programs for continuous learning and development
Work from anywhere in the world for 40 days per year
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Opportunities to collaborate and socialize with team members through quarterly team events and yearly company-wide events
Monthly transportation and fitness budget
Discounts for you, your friends, and family on GetYourGuide activities
Language reimbursement program
Health and wellness benefits


And more‚Ä¶

How To Apply

Submit your CV/resume in English using the form below. For tips and insights into our hiring process and culture, check out ‚Äòhow we hire‚Äô and ‚Äòlife at GetYourGuide‚Äô. If you have any further questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch at jobs@getyourguide.com.

We‚Äôre an equal opportunities employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with your application.
