Title: Staff Data Scientist - (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Data Scientist to join our Quick Commerce Commercial Tribe. In this role you will be exposed to various topics related to our Quick Commerce business ‚Äì assortment optimisation, content generation, promotion effectiveness improvement, and ranking. You will help other Data Scientists to deliver high quality solutions, challenge our assumptions and improve DS practices across our teams.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will work closely with multiple cross-functional teams (Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Software Engineers) to build and maintain highly scalable and reliable ML services deployed in dozens of countries globally with millions of customers.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Guide the discovery of new innovative data products from conception to operationalization to help optimize our systems and improve the experience for our users.
Keep yourself up to date and suggest state-of-the-art models to find out what works best for our customers.
Be the main reference point for new research and tech quality of Data Science in Qcommerce Commercial & Media Solutions tribes.
Enable collaboration and knowledge sharing by pushing cross teams‚Äô projects.
Set up our teams for success by creating a long-term vision, a mid-term strategy, and several short-term roadmaps toward some of the most complex and interesting data problems.
Last but not least, you are not afraid to build global systems that are used by thousands of people and constantly strive for excellence.


Qualifications


Strong Statistical & ML Foundation ‚Äì Comfortable with fundamentals, first-principles thinking, and ML theory across various domains.
Software Engineering Best Practices ‚Äì Write maintainable Python code, ensuring high standards in production systems (observability, monitoring, performance).
Domain Expertise ‚Äì Deep knowledge in at least one relevant area, such as causal inference, time series, Bayesian methods, NLP/LLM, ranking/matching, or advanced experimentation.
Data-Driven Approach ‚Äì Carefully question assumptions before working on use cases and prioritize clean, reliable data.
Effective Communication & Agile Mindset ‚Äì Filter and prioritize stakeholder requirements, focusing on MVPs and agile development.
Mentorship & Collaboration ‚Äì Support team growth through mentoring while emphasizing reliability, disciplined experimentation, and data-focused development.


Nice to Have:


Leadership & Operational Excellence ‚Äì Proven leadership in driving operational excellence and best practices within engineering teams.
System Design & Scalability ‚Äì Experience designing and implementing large, scalable distributed systems using microservices and heterogeneous platform components, with knowledge of GCP.
Expertise in Testing & Knowledge Sharing ‚Äì Strong background in A/B testing to analyze model effectiveness, with a record of knowledge sharing through conferences or publications.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and Courses.

Description:
F√ºr unseren Gesch√§ftsbereich Transformation suchen wir dich zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt als¬†Trainee Data Analytics (w/m/d).
¬†

Das erwartet dich

Individualit√§t¬†‚Äì Mit einem f√ºr dich ma√ügeschneiderten sechsmonatigen Ausbildungsplan wirst du optimal auf das Berufsfeld des Business-Analytics-Beraters im SAP-Umfeld vorbereitet. Teil des Traineeprogramms werden z.B. fachliche und technologische Trainings, Schulungen und Arbeitsmethoden sein, welche mit einer SAP-Zertifizierung abschlie√üen.

Analytics ‚Äì¬†Du leitest aus den Gesch√§ftsprozessen die Anforderungen an die Business-Analytics-L√∂sungen ab und entwickelst ganzheitliche Anwendungen. Unsere Beratungsteams begleiten in allen Phasen der Projektrealisierung: Von der Anforderungs- und Bedarfsanalyse √ºber die Erstellung betriebswirtschaftlicher Konzepte, bis zur Realisierung und Implementierung.

Beratungsfunktion¬†‚Äì Wir beraten unsere Kunden in den Themen rund um SAP Business and Analytics, SAP Business Intelligence, SAP S/4HANA (Embedded Analytics) und SAP HANA Cloud.

Datenanalyse ‚Äì¬†Mit Werkzeugen aus den Bereichen Big Data, Predictive Analytics, Business AI, Cloud Computing, Business Analytics und Business Intelligence deckst du das gesamte Spektrum der Datenanalyse ab.

¬†

Das bringst du mit

¬†

Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Ingenieurwesens, der Mathematik, der Statistik oder eines verwandten Fachbereichs hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen oder stehst kurz davor.

Du bist begeistert davon, dich mit den Feldern Business and Analytics und Business AI auseinanderzusetzen und in diesem Umfeld L√∂sungen mit unseren Kunden zu entwickeln.

Idealerweise kannst du erste Erfahrungen in Form von Praktika oder Werkstundentent√§tigkeiten im Bereich Business and Analytics oder Business AI vorweisen.

Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift bringst du mit.

Das Traineeprogramm startet zum¬†01.10.2025.

¬†

Deine Benefits

Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die M√∂glichkeit, im Home Office sowie in √ºber 40 L√§ndern zu arbeiten.

Masterf√∂rderung ‚Äì Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Dar√ºber hinaus bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit einer Masterf√∂rderung f√ºr Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Freizeit ‚Äì Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zus√§tzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland √úberstunden auf einem pers√∂nlichen Jahresarbeitszeitskonto sammeln. Deine √úberstunden kannst du im Laufe des Jahres durch Freizeit ausgleichen. Restliche √úberstunden werden einmal j√§hrlich ausgezahlt.

Gesundheit ‚Äì Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von verg√ºnstigten Beitr√§gen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles ‚Äì Wir m√∂chten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten m√∂glich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

¬†

¬†

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu l√∂sen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Finance Transformation Teams unterst√ºtzt du Unternehmen dabei, ihre Finanzabteilung zu einem noch st√§rkeren Businesspartner zu machen und so die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit des gesamten Unternehmens schneller voranzutreiben. Dabei ist unser Themenspektrum breit: Von CFO-Strategie √ºber Process Excellence, ERP-Systemen, Quality Assurance, Compliance und Data Management. Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette sicher.

¬†

Analytics ‚Äì Du leitest aus den Gesch√§ftsprozessen die Anforderungen an die Business-Analytics-L√∂sungen ab und entwickelst ganzheitliche Anwendungen. Unsere Beratungsteams begleiten in allen Phasen der Projektrealisierung: Von der Anforderungs- und Bedarfsanalyse √ºber die Erstellung betriebswirtschaftlicher Konzepte, bis zur Realisierung und Implementierung.

Beratungsfunktion ‚Äì Wir beraten unsere Kunden in den Themen rund um SAP Business and Analytics, SAP Business Intelligence, SAP S/4HANA (Embedded Analytics) und SAP HANA Cloud.

Datenanalyse ‚Äì Mit Werkzeugen aus den Bereichen Big Data, Predictive Analytics, Business AI, Cloud Computing, Business Analytics und Business Intelligence deckst du das gesamte Spektrum der Datenanalyse ab.

 

Das bringst du mit

 

  • Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Ingenieurwesens, der Mathematik, der Statistik oder eines verwandten Fachbereichs hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen oder stehst kurz davor.

  • Du bist begeistert davon, dich mit den Feldern Business and Analytics und Business AI auseinanderzusetzen und in diesem Umfeld L√∂sungen mit unseren Kunden zu entwickeln.

  • Idealerweise kannst du erste Erfahrungen in Form von Praktika oder Werkstundentent√§tigkeiten im Bereich Business and Analytics oder Business AI vorweisen.

  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift bringst du mit.

  • Das Traineeprogramm startet zum 01.10.2025.

 

Deine Benefits

Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die M√∂glichkeit, im Home Office sowie in √ºber 40 L√§ndern zu arbeiten.

Masterf√∂rderung ‚Äì Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Dar√ºber hinaus bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit einer Masterf√∂rderung f√ºr Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Freizeit ‚Äì Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zus√§tzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland √úberstunden auf einem pers√∂nlichen Jahresarbeitszeitskonto sammeln. Deine √úberstunden kannst du im Laufe des Jahres durch Freizeit ausgleichen. Restliche √úberstunden werden einmal j√§hrlich ausgezahlt.

Gesundheit ‚Äì Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von verg√ºnstigten Beitr√§gen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles ‚Äì Wir m√∂chten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten m√∂glich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

 

 

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu l√∂sen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Finance Transformation Teams unterst√ºtzt du Unternehmen dabei, ihre Finanzabteilung zu einem noch st√§rkeren Businesspartner zu machen und so die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit des gesamten Unternehmens schneller voranzutreiben. Dabei ist unser Themenspektrum breit: Von CFO-Strategie √ºber Process Excellence, ERP-Systemen, Quality Assurance, Compliance und Data Management. Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette sicher.

 

Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Theresa Volders unter +49 1515 4092298.

Title: Intern Commercial Performance (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world‚Äôs most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

Job Description


Support Assortment Optimization
Assist in analyzing product performance and customer preferences to ensure our shelves are filled with the most relevant, in-demand items.
Contribute to regular assortment reviews by analyzing internal sales data and competitor offerings.
Contribute to Pricing Strategy Execution
Help monitor price competitiveness across our categories and markets.
Work with pricing tools and dashboards to ensure price accuracy and alignment with strategy.
Dive into Commercial Performance Insights
Assist in uncovering trends in product performance, customer behavior, and pricing impact across different categories and markets.
Translate raw data into clear, actionable insights.
Assist in Strategic Projects
Be involved in ongoing initiatives aimed at improving margins and enhancing overall commercial performance.
Collaborate Cross-Functionally
Work with different stakeholders in the company to align on commercial strategies.

Qualifications


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Business, Economics, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and a passion for working with data.
Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets; familiarity with SQL, Python, data visualization tools (e.g., Looker) is a big plus.
Excellent command of English (written and spoken); German or Dutch is a plus.
Enthusiasm for the food/grocery industry and e-commerce.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
A proactive mindset, attention to detail, and eagerness to learn.


Additional Information


26 days of vacation
A mobility budget of 35 EUR per month for Deutschland Ticket subsidy
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Intern, Data Labeler (Spanish Speaker) - (Global Discovery, Consumer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an Intern, Data Labeler (Spanish Speaker) to join the Discovery team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

At the center of our marketplace is the Discovery organization. This team is currently building Search, Recommendation, and intent collection systems to power our brands like Foodpanda, Glovo, Pedidos Ya, Talabat - serving millions of requests every day. The systems we build are critical for our online marketplaces with high availability and performance requirements and drive meaningful commercial value. They require crafting control loops through data, machine learning, and online serving systems to serve millions of consumers worldwide.

In this role you will


Accurately label and annotate various types of data, including images, text, audio, and video.
Helping us in maintaining data quality and consistency, which directly impacts users' search experience, by adhering to established guidelines.
Collaborate with the team to identify and resolve labeling discrepancies.
Provide feedback on labeling guidelines and suggest improvements.


Qualifications


Currently doing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field: Business/Finance/Accounting/Engineering or recently graduated.
Ability to deal with lots of data resources and documents
Fluency in spoken and written English & Spanish
Availability of 20 hours per week for 6 months.


Nice to have:


interest in machine learning concepts.
Experience with specific data labeling tools.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Junior Sustainability Data Analyst | Researcher | Data Engineer (w/d/m)
Description:
80% der CO2-Emissionen von Unternehmen liegen in ihrer Lieferkette - aber Lieferketten sind komplex, es fehlt Transparenz. ctrl+s bietet Unternehmen den shortcut in die Lieferkette: Mit unserem statistischen Modell berechnen wir blitzschnell die CO2-Baseline. Unsere Lieferanten-Engagement-plattform erm√∂glicht dann die effiziente Minderung. Dabei ist unser Anspruch: WeTalkNumbers - belastbare Daten, echte Minderungen, no bullshit.

Deine Vielseitigkeit ist gefragt: Du findest neue Datenquellen, bindest sie an, optimierst bestehende Prozesse und hilfst dabei, datenbasierte Erkenntnisse klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten ‚Äì sei es f√ºr unsere Produkte, technische Dokumentationen oder f√ºr Kundenprojekte. Du arbeitest mit SQL, Python (oder R) und bringst ein gutes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr Datenarchitekturen und Automatisierung mit. Und was du davon noch nicht kannst ‚Äì lernst du bei uns schnell.

Gestaltungsspielraum in einem jungen Unternehmen, das Deine Perspektive sch√§tzt


Belastbare Nachhaltigkeitsexpertise ‚Äì Du willst helfen anhand echter Daten Unternehmen Richtung net-zero zu f√ºhren.


Kund:innen, die wirklich einen Unterschied machen, weil sie einen gro√üen Hebel haben, CO2 zu sparen ‚Äì wie z.B. Siemens, Bosch, Bayer, EY und Capgemini



Qualifikation



Berufseinsteiger:innen oder junge Berufst√§tige mit maximal einem Jahr Berufserfahrung


Generalist:innen, die Freude daran haben, sich vielf√§tig einzubringen.


Die F√§higkeit, bestehende Datenarchitekturen weiterzuentwickeln und neue Datenpipelines aufzubauen.


Lust sich innerhalb kurzer Zeit in ESG-Themen einzuarbeiten, relevante datenbasierte Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und diese verst√§ndlich sowie visuell ansprechend aufzubereiten.


Studium im MINT Bereich.


Erste Erfahrungen mit SQL und R oder Python ‚Äì Kenntnisse in git sind hilfreich. Wichtig ist vor allem ein sicherer Umgang mit Daten.


Akribie - sowohl bei der Entwicklung von L√∂sungen als auch in der Dokumentation f√ºrs Team.


Interesse an unternehmerischen Umweltbelastungen und Sozialrisiken.


Die Bereitschaft Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen und den Drang Themen und Projekte auch eigenst√§ndig umzusetzen.


Deutschkenntnisse auf B1- Niveau





Gestalte gemeinsam mit uns ctrl+s!




Wir suche ab sofort und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung bis zum 25.08.2025. unter Nennung Deiner Gehaltserwartung und fr√ºhestm√∂glichem Startdatum.

  • Lust sich innerhalb kurzer Zeit in ESG-Themen einzuarbeiten, relevante datenbasierte Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und diese verst√§ndlich sowie visuell ansprechend aufzubereiten.

  • Studium im MINT Bereich.

  • Erste Erfahrungen mit SQL und R oder Python ‚Äì Kenntnisse in git sind hilfreich. Wichtig ist vor allem ein sicherer Umgang mit Daten.

  • Akribie - sowohl bei der Entwicklung von L√∂sungen als auch in der Dokumentation f√ºrs Team.

  • Interesse an unternehmerischen Umweltbelastungen und Sozialrisiken.

  • Die Bereitschaft Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen und den Drang Themen und Projekte auch eigenst√§ndig umzusetzen.

  • Deutschkenntnisse auf B1- Niveau


Gestalte gemeinsam mit uns ctrl+s!


Wir suche ab sofort und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung bis zum 25.08.2025. unter Nennung Deiner Gehaltserwartung und fr√ºhestm√∂glichem Startdatum.

Title: Junior Database Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

Position Summary

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.

Learning Opportunities & Responsibilities


Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
Support data validation and quality assurance processes
Participate in troubleshooting data inconsistencies
Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
Learn Docker basics and container management
Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
Participate in database design reviews and team meetings



Required Basic Skills


Educational Background:
Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses

Technical Foundation:
Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
Comfortable with command-line interfaces
Strong analytical mindset

Soft Skills:
Excellent attention to detail
Strong problem-solving abilities
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Eagerness to learn new technologies



Good to Have Skills


Previous internship or project experience with databases
Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with any ERD or database design tools
Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
Understanding of JSON data format
Exposure to Linux/Unix environments
GitHub experience for version control
Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
Basic understanding of API concepts



What You'll Learn


Enterprise-level database design and optimization
Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
Modern database platforms and cloud services
Docker and containerization for databases
Real-world data synchronization challenges
Professional development practices



Internship Details


Duration: 3-6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
Flexible hours (minimum 20 hours/week)
Remote work available
Mentorship from senior database engineers
Hands-on experience with production systems
Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

Title: Visiting Founders Associate - Excel Power User & Capital Markets
Description:
We (Jan, Fernando) are building kontext21 an AI startup focused on harnessing professionals work context.




Our first product is X21 an Excel AI add-in focus on financial modelling for PE, M&A and investment banks.




We are backed by some great Investors: Antler, VR Ventures and Angels.


Tasks



Work directly with the founders on validating our first product for Excel power users


Build and test AI-powered features that supercharge Excel ‚Äî turning spreadsheets into intelligent assistants


Become the ‚Äúvoice of the spreadsheet user‚Äù in product and design conversations


Research real-world use cases and help shape product features from the ground up


Be part of early outreach: talk to users, design experiments, analyze workflows


Launch your own side-project or automation, codenamed ‚ÄúExcel‚Äù, powered by our SDK ‚Äî a ‚Äústartup within‚Äù


Bonus: use your Excel skills to hack internal ops, tracking, and dashboards



Requirements



You have used Excel for 20+ hours per week ‚Äî professionally or obsessively


You can build and debug complex formulas or have built complex financial models or other analytical models before


Bonus: experience with Power Query, VBA, or Google Sheets scripting


Passion for tech startups and excitement to be at the earliest stage


Sharp analytical thinking and a relentless drive to make things better


You love to ship, test, learn, and iterate ‚Äî not sit on ideas





Why you shouldn't join:





You are not comfortable working without a clear structure.


You have >3 years of experience and look for that to be reflected in the pay. Our budget can not support that.


You are not ready for a career opportunity with risks. Despite our growth, we are still an early-stage startup. If you need something more predictable, this is not the right fit.



Benefits



Flexible working hours


Sport membership


Learn from us. Check out our profiles, we are experienced founders and happy to teach.





Come as you are, let's build together.

Title: Junior or Senior Power BI Analyst
Description:
Sustainability that means business

What We Do

Our innovative SaaS solutions increase efficiency and boost sustainability in resource-intensive industries. Over 5,000 customers across 23 countries already benefit from our Performance Sustainability software, ensuring we deliver practical solutions for improved profitability and environmental resilience across the globe.

Who We Are

Sustainability software specialist, AMCS, is headquartered in Ireland, with offices in Europe, USA, Canada and Australasia. With over 1,300 highly-skilled employees across 22 countries, we specialize in delivering technology solutions to facilitate a carbon neutral future.

Our people

AMCS offers team members more than just a job, but an opportunity to map out a career with a company that is growing, evolving and setting out new ways of working that are having a positive impact on the world around us. AMCS was established in Ireland and holds onto those local roots and ‚Äòstart-up‚Äô mentality with a culture of connection. Connection to our work, our customers, our colleagues and our community that creates a working environment that fosters openness, collaboration and creativity.

We are seeking a skilled Junior or Senior Power BI Analyst to join our Analytics team, with a particular focus on Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing dashboards that help our customers leverage data-driven insights for optimization and decision-making in EHS and ESG areas. You will collaborate closely with customer stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and deliver actionable insights through data visualization.

Key Responsibilities


Managing projects with customers.
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Apache Superset or Power BI focused on EHS and ESG performance metrics.
Collaborate with the customer¬¥s EHS and ESG teams to gather requirements and understand specific data needs for compliance, reporting, and sustainability initiatives.
Work with our ESG & EHS data models to create dashboards customized for our customers in Apache Superset or Power BI.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across all reports and dashboards, particularly in relation to EHS compliance and ESG disclosures.
Train and support end-users in the use of our Analytics solutions
Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in business intelligence technologies, especially those related to EHS and ESG reporting.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Environmental Science, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, Business Administration or a related educational training or experience from another context.
Junior: first experience in an internship or as a working student in a data analysis or reporting role in customer contact with specific experience using Power BI.


OR


Senior: 2+ years of experience in a data analysis or reporting role with customer interaction including project management. Specific experience using in Apache Superset and Power BI are a plus.
Experience in data modelling, DAX language and Power Query.
Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and visualization.
Junior: Basic understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.


OR


Senior: Proficient understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with databases (SQL Server, Maria DB etc.) and data warehousing concepts.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.


Desirable Qualifications


Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics and related reporting requirements. (e.g., GRI, SASB, TCFD).
Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques.
Experience with other BI tools (Apache Superset, Sisense, etc.)

Title: Data & AI Consultant (m/f/d)
Description:
Brief description

Dataciders, a dynamically growing group of companies in the upper midmarket, is a leading service provider in the IT service environment with a focus on data and AI in German-speaking countries. Our success is confirmed by our 1st place in the renowned L√ºnendonk list for data & analytics services.

We are characterized by our flexibility and enthusiasm for technological trends and innovations. We live change and shape the future.

At ixto, you will work in an interdisciplinary team from IT, economics, data science and other exciting disciplines - united by a passion for turning ideas into real solutions. You will not only be given room for your expertise, but also the freedom to actively shape our projects, processes and culture. Innovation is not a department for us - it is our everyday life.

What you can expect in your new job


Projects in state-of-the-art data & AI technologies
Challenges along the entire data value chain: from the cloud platform to the data loading route to the BI report and ML model
Varied activities between customer workshops and coding sessions
Exciting customers in the DACH region from a wide range of industries


Your profile


You have a high ability to learn and enthusiasm for current developments in the field of data & AI
You are self-confident and customer-oriented - both in workshops and in long-term customer projects
You have experience with current AI/ML technologies such as OpenAI's GPT models, Microsoft Azure AI Foundry or Databricks Mosaic AI
You have experience in current data technologies such as Microsoft Fabric or Databricks
You are proficient in Python; we would like to see knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. Java, C#, TypeScript)
Ideally, you have experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP
You are characterized by strong communication skills, ability to work in a team and willingness to travel
You are proficient in German (C1) and English (C1)


What we offer you

We are a leading provider of customized data solutions that form the basis for important decisions for our customers. Join us in designing projects that work!


A well-coordinated team of inquisitive talents and experienced consultants
A working environment that promotes personal responsibility, trust and real participation
Personal development with learning time budgets and knowledge transfer within the team
Regular team and sports events - from online lunches to annual retreats
Projects with real added value: our solutions create transparency and decision-making security for our customers
flexible working hours
Further training
modern hardware
Extensive sports & wellness flat rate via leading company fitness providers
Support for your mental fitness via OpenUp, a strong offer for mental health and resilience promotion
Fruit and drinks in the office


We are looking forward to your application!

Have we piqued your interest? Then apply now!

Take your chance and send your complete application with CV, cover letter and references, stating your salary expectations and availability, as a PDF document.

You are also welcome to send an e-mail to: jobs@dataciders.com

  • Personal development with learning time budgets and knowledge transfer within the team

  • Projects with real added value: our solutions create transparency and decision-making security for our customers
  • flexible working hours
  • Further training
  • modern hardware
  • Extensive sports & wellness flat rate via leading company fitness providers

Title: Performance Analyst Lead
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We are seeking a highly experienced and driven Performance Analytics lead to join our Operations Team. As a strategic leader within the team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our operational intelligence and performance insights. Beyond standard analytical functions, this role operates with a broader perspective. You'll be expected to lead cross-functional initiatives, influence decision-makers, and mentor team members while delivering clear, actionable insights that shape strategic direction.

The Operations Analytics Team functions as the central hub for data-driven decision-making across operations performance. The role supports stakeholders across multiple verticals, drives automations, and provides insights that are critical to upper management and leadership.

What You'll Be Doing


Strategic Analysis & Insight Development: Lead complex, high-impact analyses using Looker, Python, and advanced Excel to uncover operational opportunities and efficiencies.
Team Leadership & Mentorship: Manage and mentor analysts, fostering a high-performance culture through skill development, feedback, and support.
Data Translation & Communication: Translate complex data into accessible insights, tailored for diverse audiences including non-technical stakeholders, executive leadership, and global partners.
Executive Engagement: Regularly engage with leadership, presenting insights and recommendations that drive strategic planning and execution.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Build strong internal and external networks across markets to share best practices, standardize reporting frameworks, and promote data-driven cultures.
Process Optimization: Champion and implement process automation to improve operational efficiency and reporting scalability.
Presentation & Reporting: Deliver visually compelling presentations and dashboards, clearly communicating findings and business implications.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proven managerial experience with the ability to lead and scale a team.
Strong expertise in Python and Looker.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools.
A solid analytical background with a focus on delivering operational insights.
Outstanding communication skills, with a track record of making complex data easily understandable.
Experience in creating and presenting high-level reports to stakeholders.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and self-motivated with a growth mindset.
Comfortable networking at a global, cross-functional level.


Nice-to-Have:


Experience working in fast-paced tech or operational environments.
Proficiency in SQL and/or other BI platforms.
Flexibility to adapt to evolving business priorities


Why Join Us?

This is more than just an analytics role, it's an opportunity to become a leader in shaping how data influences operations strategy. You'll work at the intersection of business, data, and innovation, making a tangible impact on our continued success.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: CEO Associate
Description:
Unsere Mission




Bei Checkturio bauen wir den europ√§ischen Marktf√ºhrer f√ºr die Digitalisierung von Fahrzeugpr√ºfungen und Wartungsmanagement auf. Unsere B2B-SaaS-Plattform unterst√ºtzt Logistik- und Transportunternehmen dabei, kritische Betriebsprozesse zu digitalisieren ‚Äì Ausfallzeiten zu reduzieren, Compliance zu verbessern und die Sicherheit von Fahrzeugflotten zu erh√∂hen.




Wir sind ein Early-Stage-Startup mit Sitz in Berlin, haben ein marktreifes Produkt, zahlende Kunden und strategische Investoren im R√ºcken. Jetzt treten wir in eine spannende Wachstumsphase ein ‚Äì und suchen eine engagierte Pers√∂nlichkeit, die uns beim Skalieren unterst√ºtzt.


Deine Rolle




Als CEO Associate arbeitest du direkt mit unserem CEO zusammen, um Wachstum zu beschleunigen und neue Gesch√§ftsm√∂glichkeiten zu schaffen.

Dein Schwerpunkt liegt auf der Umsetzung von Marketing-Initiativen, die Inbound-Anfragen generieren, sowie auf der Unterst√ºtzung gezielter Outbound-Aktivit√§ten, dem direkten Austausch mit Kunden und der Koordination von Pilotprojekten.

Diese Position bietet wertvolle Vertriebserfahrung und direkten Kundenkontakt ‚Äì du erh√§ltst Einblicke in den Markt aus erster Hand und die M√∂glichkeit, aktiv daran mitzuwirken, wie wir Interessenten gewinnen, √ºberzeugen und langfristig binden.

Dar√ºber hinaus spielst du eine wichtige Rolle im Fundraising und in der Investor Relations, indem du Materialien erstellst, KPIs trackst und den Kontakt zu Stakeholdern pflegst.




Deine Hauptaufgaben




1. Marketing & Inbound Sales Development

Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Marketinginitiativen zur Gewinnung und Ansprache potenzieller Kunden (z. B. LinkedIn-Kampagnen, Case Studies, Newsletter, PR).
Ausbau des Produktmarketings √ºber alle relevanten Kan√§le mit Fokus auf messbare Lead-Generierung.
Zusammenarbeit mit dem CEO und dem Team zur Themenfindung und Erstellung von Content, der Inbound-Interesse weckt.
Verwaltung von eingehenden Leads inkl. Erfassung, Qualifizierung und Follow-up.
√úberwachung und Optimierung von Kampagnen zur Steigerung der Conversion Rate von Marketingkan√§len in Pilotprojekte.




2. Growth Hacking & Experimentation

Testen innovativer Taktiken zur Reichweiten- und Engagementsteigerung in Zielm√§rkten.
Experimentieren mit verschiedenen Kan√§len, Formaten und Botschaften zur Optimierung der Lead-Generierung.
Nutzung von Automatisierungstools (HubSpot, LinkedIn, Apollo, Clay etc.) zur Effizienzsteigerung.




3. Vertriebserfahrung & Kundenkontakt

Teilnahme an Gespr√§chen, Demos und Veranstaltungen mit potenziellen Kunden, um deren Bed√ºrfnisse zu verstehen.
Unterst√ºtzung bei der Lead-Qualifizierung und Pilotkoordination.
Aufbau und Pflege von Beziehungen zu Interessenten und Branchenkontakten.




4. Sales Operations & Reporting

Sicherstellen einer gepflegten und nutzbaren CRM-Datenbasis (HubSpot).
Tracking und Reporting von Lead-Generierung und Kampagnenperformance √ºber BI-Tools (Looker).
Analyse von Conversion-Daten zur Identifizierung kurzfristiger Chancen und langfristiger Verbesserungen.




5. Fundraising & Investor Relations

Unterst√ºtzung des CEOs bei der Erstellung von Pitch-Decks, Finanzberichten und KPI-Dashboards.
Koordination von Investoren-Updates und Pflege der Stakeholder-Beziehungen.
Mitwirkung an Due-Diligence-Prozessen und der Organisation von Fundraising-Aktivit√§ten.




6. Strategische CEO-Unterst√ºtzung

Mitarbeit an wichtigen kommerziellen und operativen Projekten.
Strukturierung und Optimierung interner Prozesse zur Unterst√ºtzung des Unternehmenswachstums.




Dein Profil




Deutsch als Muttersprache, flie√üend in Englisch.
1‚Äì4 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Marketing, Business Development, Consulting oder in einem anderen dynamischen Umfeld.
W√ºnschenswert: Erfahrung im B2B-SaaS-Bereich oder in der Logistik-/Transportbranche.
Ausgepr√§gte schriftliche und m√ºndliche Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten sowie Talent f√ºr die Erstellung √ºberzeugender Inhalte.
Sicher im Kundenkontakt und in der Lage, den Mehrwert klar zu vermitteln.
Sehr gute organisatorische F√§higkeiten und die F√§higkeit, mehrere Projekte parallel zu managen.
Erfahrung mit digitalen Marketing-Tools (LinkedIn Campaign Manager, HubSpot, Google Analytics) von Vorteil.
Datengetriebene Denkweise und Interesse an Produkt- und Technologiethemen.
Hands-on-Mentalit√§t, pragmatisch und motiviert, in eine F√ºhrungsrolle hineinzuwachsen.
Wohnhaft in Berlin (oder bereit umzuziehen) ‚Äì vor Ort, Vollzeit.




Was wir bieten




Direkten Zugang zum CEO, zu Vertriebsprozessen und zum Marktgeschehen.
Die M√∂glichkeit, deine Rolle aktiv mitzugestalten und in einem schnell wachsenden Startup Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen.
Eigenverantwortung f√ºr Marketing-, Inbound- und kundenorientierte Projekte ab Tag eins.
B√ºro im Herzen von Berlin (Mitte) mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum.
Wettbewerbsf√§higes Gehalt (Fixum + leistungsabh√§ngiger Bonus).
Unterst√ºtzung durch erfahrene strategische Investoren und einen klaren Wachstumsplan.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
Data Engineer (f/m/x) - Berlin

EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in enhancing the quality and effectiveness of our data landscape and the positive impact data has on Tourlane and our customers.

WHAT IS THE ROLE ABOUT?


Closely collaborating with data analysts, analytics engineers and other consumers of Tourlane data to maintain and incrementally improve our hosted data services
Improving and extending our existing data ELT processes, focusing on our ‚Äòbronze‚Äô and ‚Äòsilver‚Äô layer within our data architecture
Implementing automation features for the GDPR compliance of our data warehouse
Supporting analysts in remodeling their domain specific data in order to migrate into our new DWH structure (Medallion Architecture), if needed
Consulting our internal data producers in non-breaking data changes and modeling
Coaching less experienced colleagues (i.e. analysts) across our data stack and strongly contributing to our department-wide data governance initiatives



WHAT WILL YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL?


Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS) and orchestration tools
Proficiency in building and scaling, monitoring, and maintaining data pipelines
Strong communication with stakeholders with different levels of coding / data experience
Mid-level knowledge in SQL and dbt, experienced working with relational databases and solid programming skills in Python
Experience with modern data modeling concepts and data warehousing architecture
Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles



TOOLS WE USE?


Infrastructure provisioning: Terraform
Ingestion and orchestration: Fivetran, Airbyte, Dagster
Real-time tracking: Snowplow
Transformation/modeling: dbt
Data quality: Synq
Data warehouse: Snowflake
Reporting: Looker / LookML



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP).
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health through sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can‚Äôt wait to meet your furry friend!



‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Title: SOC Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking a SOC Analyst to help us manage security incident response and strategically anticipate future threats against our infrastructure.

Our Security Operations Center (SOC) team is at the front line of defense against security threats, working to keep N26 customers' bank accounts safe by detecting and responding to threats in our cloud and on-premise infrastructure.

We believe in proactive security, automation, and continuous improvement to stay ahead of evolving threats.

In This Role, You Will


Proactively search for threats, indicators of compromises (IoCs), advanced persistent threats (APTs) and anomalous behavior across the enterprise.
Develop and execute custom threat hunting hypotheses using threat intelligence, and attack frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK
Create and maintain detection content (queries, dashboards and alerts)
Stay current with emerging threats and vulnerabilities
Contributing to Information Sharing and Analysis Center (ISAC) initiatives
Use monitoring tools to detect and respond to security alerts.
Design and build automation for security incident detection and response processes.
Establish guidelines, standards, and runbooks for teams to respond to incidents and alerts.
Work with engineering teams to increase log coverage and visibility.
Perform reactive incident response when security events occur.


What You Need to Be Successful

Background


Relevant experience (3-5 years) working in SOC team
Experience working with SIEMs and familiarity with log formats, and writing SIEM detection rules
Understanding of monitoring and processing security events at scale.
Strong knowledge of IT security domains.
Familiarity with host-based and network-based intrusion detection systems.
Solid understanding of Linux and ability to write shell scripts.
Knowledge of vulnerability management and threat hunting
Knowledge of cyber threat intelligence (CTI) and threat intelligence platform (TIP)


Skills


Incident response and threat detection methodologies.
Familiarity with security frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK and NIST.
Strong analytical skills for working with large-scale data and identifying anomalies.
Knowledge of networking concepts, including firewalls, IDS/IPS, and packet analysis.
Ability to analyze malware, phishing attempts, and intrusion attempts.
Scripting and automation skills in Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
Strong communication skills to document incidents and collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Nice To Haves


Software engineering experience in Java, Kotlin, Go, or Python.
Understanding of cloud environments, ideally AWS.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe‚Äôs most talked about disruptors üöÄ.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who we are

N26 has reimagined banking for today‚Äôs digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it‚Äôs how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

Equal Opportunities

We recognize that our strength lies in our people and the varied perspectives they bring to our workforce. We strive to build talented and diverse teams to drive our business success and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We genuinely welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, neurodiversities, and ages. We're committed to creating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued and respected, free from harassment and discrimination. If there's anything you need to make the application process work for you, please let us know by reaching out to candidate.exp@n26.com.

Visit our website to learn more about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at N26.

HTML:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking a SOC Analyst to help us manage security incident response and strategically anticipate future threats against our infrastructure.

Our Security Operations Center (SOC) team is at the front line of defense against security threats, working to keep N26 customers' bank accounts safe by detecting and responding to threats in our cloud and on-premise infrastructure.

We believe in proactive security, automation, and continuous improvement to stay ahead of evolving threats.

In This Role, You Will

  • Proactively search for threats, indicators of compromises (IoCs), advanced persistent threats (APTs) and anomalous behavior across the enterprise.
  • Develop and execute custom threat hunting hypotheses using threat intelligence, and attack frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK
  • Create and maintain detection content (queries, dashboards and alerts)
  • Stay current with emerging threats and vulnerabilities
  • Contributing to Information Sharing and Analysis Center (ISAC) initiatives
  • Use monitoring tools to detect and respond to security alerts.
  • Design and build automation for security incident detection and response processes.
  • Establish guidelines, standards, and runbooks for teams to respond to incidents and alerts.
  • Work with engineering teams to increase log coverage and visibility.
  • Perform reactive incident response when security events occur.

What You Need to Be Successful

Background

  • Relevant experience (3-5 years) working in SOC team
  • Experience working with SIEMs and familiarity with log formats, and writing SIEM detection rules
  • Understanding of monitoring and processing security events at scale.
  • Strong knowledge of IT security domains.
  • Familiarity with host-based and network-based intrusion detection systems.
  • Solid understanding of Linux and ability to write shell scripts.
  • Knowledge of vulnerability management and threat hunting
  • Knowledge of cyber threat intelligence (CTI) and threat intelligence platform (TIP)

Skills

  • Incident response and threat detection methodologies.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK and NIST.
  • Strong analytical skills for working with large-scale data and identifying anomalies.
  • Knowledge of networking concepts, including firewalls, IDS/IPS, and packet analysis.
  • Ability to analyze malware, phishing attempts, and intrusion attempts.
  • Scripting and automation skills in Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
  • Strong communication skills to document incidents and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Nice To Haves

  • Software engineering experience in Java, Kotlin, Go, or Python.
  • Understanding of cloud environments, ideally AWS.

What‚Äôs In It For You

  • Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe‚Äôs most talked about disruptors üöÄ.
  • Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
  • As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
  • Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
  • A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
  • A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.

Who we are

N26 has reimagined banking for today‚Äôs digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it‚Äôs how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

Equal Opportunities

We recognize that our strength lies in our people and the varied perspectives they bring to our workforce. We strive to build talented and diverse teams to drive our business success and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We genuinely welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, neurodiversities, and ages. We're committed to creating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued and respected, free from harassment and discrimination. If there's anything you need to make the application process work for you, please let us know by reaching out to candidate.exp@n26.com.

Visit our website to learn more about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at N26.

Title: Junior Economist (d/m/f)
Description:
Schaeffler ‚Äì the fascination of an international technology group combined with the culture of a family-owned company. As a partner to all major automotive manufacturers and numerous customers in the industrial sector, we offer you plenty of scope for personal development.

Your Responsibilities


Observation and analysis of macroeconomic and geopolitical developments, including filtering of economic news for relevance
Identification and assesment of macroeconomic (and geopolitical) risks and (their) interdependencies
Creation of meaningful reports and presentations
Development of scenarios on current macroeconomic and geopolitical issues


Your Profile


Master Degree in Economics
Relevant internships, preferably with international experience
First job experience in risk management is a plus
Strong analytical skills for macroeconomic, political, and geopolitical analysis
Ability to analyze complex qualitative (e.g. political, geopolitical) matters as well as Data affinity
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì verbal and in writing as well as curiosity, going the extra mile
Team player with initiative and motivation to actively contribute to a small, specialized team as well as the ability to work autonomously
Proficiency in German and English at a very high level as well as a high level proficiency on a third language is a preferential criteria


What We Offer

We offer flexible working hours, attractive remuneration and the following benefits:


Modern working environment in New Work office spaces
Hybrid working model (mix of remote work and office days)
A wide range of development opportunities through the Schaeffler Academy
Recognition of your creativity, e.g. through the Schaeffler Awards and idea management
Health and sports offerings, e.g. through the Schaeffler Health Coach app
Building up an additional pension through the company pension scheme


Many Other Employee Benefits, Including Corporate Benefits

As a global company, we employ people all over the world. It is important to us that we treat each other with respect and are open, positive and unbiased towards all ideas and perspectives. By valuing our differences, we strengthen our creativity and promote innovation. In this way, we contribute to sustainable value creation for our customers, business partners and society as a whole. Together, we advance how the world moves.

Exciting tasks and excellent development prospects await you, because we are shaping the future with innovation. We look forward to receiving your online application.

www.schaeffler.com/careers

Your contact

Schaeffler AG

Maria Algul

Title: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description:
Unsere Features


Bombastisch & bezaubernd: das IT-Team, das gemeinsam mit dir spannende Missionen antreten m√∂chte
Abwechslungsreich & vielversprechend: die Zukunft der Dussmann Group, die wir mit dir gestalten werden
Vertrauensvoll & flexibel: deine Arbeitszeiten
Sehenswert & reizvoll: dein Desksharing-Arbeitsplatz in der Friedrichstra√üe sowie inklusive 25% Rabatt auf alle deine Eink√§ufe im Dussmann KulturKaufhaus
Sicher & unbefristet: dein Arbeitsvertrag in einem krisenfesten Konzern
Langfristig & nachhaltig: deine Fort- und Weiterbildungsoptionen z.B. auf unserem Campus in Zeuthen
Gr√ºn & gesund: deine verg√ºnstigte Mittagspause in unserem PLANET!BASED-Restaurant im Untergeschoss
Sensationell & am√ºsant: unsere Mitarbeiterevents wie Stammtisch, After-Work, Sommer- und Weihnachtsfeste, Teamfr√ºhst√ºck etc.
Attraktiv & lukrativ: deine Verg√ºtung


Deine Mission

Du musst kein Superheld sein, um Gro√ües zu bewirken. In der Welt der Daten reicht oft ein klarer Kopf, ein gutes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr komplexe Zusammenh√§nge - und ein bisschen Freude am Coden. Wenn du gerne Strukturen schaffst, wo andere nur Daten sehen, und du dich in modernen Cloud-Technologien genauso wohlf√ºhlst wie im Austausch mit Kolleg:innen aus verschiedenen Bereichen, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Wir suchen jemanden, der mit technischem Know-how, Teamgeist und einem Blick f√ºrs Wesentliche unsere Datenplattform weiterentwickelt - und dabei vielleicht sogar ein bisschen Spa√ü hat.


Du baust Datentransformationsstrecken, die nicht nur funktionieren, sondern auch bei Nacht deployt werden k√∂nnen, ohne dass du schwei√ügebadet aufwachst - mit Tools wie Azure Databricks, Apache Airflow oder Azure Data Factory.
Du unterst√ºtzt F√ºhrungskr√§fte, indem du technische Klarheit schaffst - und manchmal auch emotionale Stabilit√§t, wenn das Deployment mal wieder zickt.
Du modellierst Daten, als w√§ren sie Lego-Steine: strukturiert, durchdacht und mit dem gewissen ‚ÄûKlick‚Äú.
Du f√ºhrst Deployments durch, dokumentierst gewissenhaft und sorgst daf√ºr, dass deine Datenqualit√§t nicht nur ‚Äûokay‚Äú, sondern ‚Äûwow‚Äú ist.
Du bist Ansprechpartner:in f√ºr System Owner - also der Mensch, der komplexe Anforderungen in verst√§ndliche L√∂sungen √ºbersetzt (und dabei nicht die Geduld verliert).
Du arbeitest mit dem AI Lab zusammen, wo du daf√ºr sorgst, dass aus fancy Algorithmen auch tats√§chlich funktionierende Produkte werden.
Du kooperierst mit BI Engineers, damit Dashboards nicht nur h√ºbsch aussehen, sondern auch die Wahrheit sagen.
Du bringst dich in Projekte ein, diskutierst Datenarchitektur mit Kolleg:innen und hast dabei sogar gelegentlich Spa√ü.
Du arbeitest mit Fachbereichen und IT, als w√§rst du ein diplomatischer Datenbotschafter - mit technischem Tiefgang und einem offenen Ohr.


Deine Skills


Du hast ein Studium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Statistik oder etwas √§hnlich Nerdigem abgeschlossen - oder dir das Wissen auf anderem Weg draufgeschafft.
Du verstehst Datenmodellierung und Softwarearchitektur - und wei√üt, dass ‚ÄûBig Data‚Äú nicht nur ein Buzzword ist.
Du kennst dich mit Azure aus (Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake) - oder mit anderen Cloud-Werkzeugen, die mindestens genauso cool sind.
SQL, Python, Spark und GIT sind f√ºr dich keine Fremdw√∂rter, sondern deine t√§glichen Begleiter - fast wie Kaffee.
Du arbeitest selbstst√§ndig, sorgf√§ltig und mit einem Auge f√ºrs Detail - auch wenn‚Äôs mal stressig wird.
Du kannst zwischen Business, IT und deinem Team vermitteln - und bleibst dabei meistens freundlich.
Dein Englisch ist verhandlungssicher - dein Humor optional, aber willkommen

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Status: 6 month Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Global Payroll Manager

Works with: Finance Team

Job Purpose

Finance team: The role is to support the payroll team in managing and improving data quality, reconciliation and reporting during a period of high operational demand. The role is essential for ensuring accurate payroll reporting, supporting the rollout of a Global Payroll Provider and preparing for upcoming compliance requirements.




Principal accountabilities

Data Cleansing & Validation

Clean, structure, and validate large payroll data to ensure accuracy and consistency (both for current operations and during the roll out of the Global Payroll provider).
Identify and correct anomalies in payroll and accounting data
Collaborate with Payroll, HR and Finance teams to ensure data alignment, particularly within the HiBob platform.

Reconciliations

Perform regular reconciliations between payroll records and general ledger accounts.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in payroll transactions and accounting entries.

Budget & Variance Analysis, Reporting

Assist in preparing payroll-related budget forecasts.
Analyse actual payroll costs against budgeted figures and explain variances.
Provide monthly variance reports with actionable insights.
Maintain year-to-date payroll reports and audit packs.
Support audits and compliance checks with accurate data and documentation.
Respond to ad hoc data requests from senior management and external auditors.
Assist in preparing data and reports for the mandatory payrolling of Benefits in Kind (BiKs) starting April 2026.
Process optimisation - Identify inefficiencies in workflows and streamline payroll processes

UAT Testing ‚Äì Global Payroll Project

Lead testing and reconciliation during parallel runs for the Global Payroll Provider rollout.

Skills And Attributes

Proven experience in data analysis within payroll or finance.
Strong Excel and data manipulation skills; experience with HiBob is a plus.
Familiarity with payroll systems, accounting principles, and compliance requirements.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
Experience supporting audits and compliance processes is desirable.
Strong communication and documentation skills.




Essential

Qualifications and experience

Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (e.g. pivot tables, lookups, data validation).
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation and validation.
Solid understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and financial reconciliations.
Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems (e.g. HiBob, Moorepay, Papaya, Justworks or similar platforms).
Demonstrated ability to produce clear, accurate and insightful reports for stakeholders.
Experience supporting audits and compliance reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred

Experience working within a global or multi-country payroll environment.
Experience participating in system implementations or UAT testing phases.
Ability to document processes and create user-friendly guides




Application Closing Date: 22nd August 2025

Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date.




Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets

The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide.

We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we‚Äôve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we‚Äôre trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we‚Äôre expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You‚Äôll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima‚Äôs data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

ü§∏Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

üèÅ Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

üåà Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you‚Äôre a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don‚Äôt meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.
Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let‚Äôs build the future of insurance, together.

HTML:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we‚Äôve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we‚Äôre trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we‚Äôre expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You‚Äôll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do

  • Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
  • Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
  • Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
  • Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
  • Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima‚Äôs data-driven culture.
  • Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
  • Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.

What We're Looking For

  • A minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
  • A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
  • A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
  • Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
  • A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.

Nice to Have

  • Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
  • Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
  • Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

ü§∏Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

üèÅ Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.
