For work arrangements that are ‚ÄòHybrid‚Äô, successful candidates must be based in Canada and report to a set Bell office for a minimum of 3 days a week. Recognizing the importance of work-life balance, Bell offers flexibility in work hours based on the business needs.

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

We know that caring for our team members is at the heart of a healthy, positive and thriving workplace. As part of our team, you‚Äôll enjoy a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary and a wide range of benefits to support the well-being of you and your family. As soon as you join us, you'll be eligible for medical, dental, vision and mental health benefits that you can tailor to your specific needs. Plus, as a Bell team member, you'll enjoy a 35% discount on our services and access exclusive offers from our partners.

At Bell, we are proud of our focus on fostering an inclusive and accessible workplace where all team members feel valued, respected, supported, and that they belong.

We also want to make sure that everyone has an equal opportunity to join our team. We encourage individuals who may require accommodations during the hiring process to let us know. For a confidential inquiry, email your recruiter or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions or feedback regarding accessibility at Bell, we invite you to complete the Accessibility feedback form or visit our Accessibility page for other ways to contact us.

Artificial intelligence may be used to assess parts of your application. Please review our privacy policy (see Phenom for details) to learn more about how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information.

Created: Canada, ON, Toronto

Bell, one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

At Momentum Financial Services Group, we help people move forward by reimagining how money works for those who need it most. With more than 40 years of experience, we're the team behind Money Mart‚ÄîCanada's largest non-bank branch network‚Äîand a leader in financial solutions for underserved communities.

From short-term loans to money transfers and prepaid cards, we power the products, technology, and operations that connect over a million customers a year to the money they need, when they need it.

At MFSG, we come together across teams and departments to create something bigger than ourselves: solutions that remove barriers and give people access to money they might not get anywhere else. Whether you're solving problems, building systems, or shaping strategy, your work fuels real support for real people.

We've Got You Covered


Compensation Philosophy: Our strategy is simple‚Äîwe aim to match the market. We regularly review industry standards to ensure our total rewards package is competitive and fair. This commitment helps us attract and retain talented individuals who share our purpose.
Discretionary Annual Bonus: Enjoy the opportunity for a discretionary bonus based on individual performance and company success.
Comprehensive Benefits: Our benefits include health and dental plans with 100% of the premiums covered. We also offer an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental well-being and provide resources for personal challenges.
Retirement Plans: Plan for your future with our robust retirement savings options, ensuring you're set for the long haul.
Hybrid Work Environment: Experience the best of both worlds with our hybrid work model, allowing you to balance remote work with in-office. When you're at our corporate head office, enjoy a relaxed and collaborative environment featuring breakout rooms for brainstorming and unwinding, plus a variety of snacks to keep you energized throughout the day.
Perks and Rewards: Enjoy reimbursement for tuition assistance and professional development, discounts through Perkopolis and participate in our rewards and recognition programs to celebrate your contributions.


The Job: Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics

We're looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics to join our growing Risk Group in Toronto. Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Analytics, you'll be the subject matter data expert‚Äîtranslating raw data into actionable insights, strategies, and solutions that drive both business success and customer outcomes. You'll work closely with stakeholders across departments to improve data processes, develop impactful reports and dashboards, and apply advanced analytics techniques to uncover trends and opportunities.

What You'll Do

Turn Data Into Actionable Insights:


Analyze large, complex datasets from multiple sources to produce accurate business metric reporting.
Conduct advanced statistical, financial, and predictive analyses to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities.
Utilize statistical modeling, predictive analytics, and machine learning to provide deeper insights into business operations and market conditions.


Build & Optimize Reporting Tools:


Design, develop, and maintain purpose-driven reports and dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
Identify inefficiencies in current data processes and implement improvements to enhance accuracy and efficiency.
Create visually compelling presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders at all levels.


Collaborate Across the Business:


Lead regular touchpoints with business stakeholders to go beyond requested deliverables‚Äîproactively suggesting data-driven solutions to improve workflows.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that meet business objectives.
Support the Sr. Manager of Analytics in defining key metrics, performance targets, and project priorities for the department.


Elevate the Analytics Function:


Continuously broaden your knowledge of different business verticals and how they use data to drive decision-making.
Ensure all analysis and reporting maintain the highest level of accuracy and attention to detail.


What You'll Bring to the Table


Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills with a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to manage the full analytics lifecycle‚Äîfrom descriptive and diagnostic analysis to predictive and prescriptive solutions.
Proven experience interpreting large datasets and presenting insights in a clear, actionable manner.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
A proactive, curious mindset with a drive to continuously improve processes and deliverables.
Strong business judgment and the ability to think both creatively and strategically.
Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively in a cross-functional environment.


Education + Experience


Bachelor's degree or higher in Decision Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Finance, or Economics.
3+ years of experience in reporting, analysis, and strategy development‚Äîpreferably in the financial services industry.
Proven proficiency in SQL, R, Python, or similar data mining and analytics tools.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, or Microsoft SSRS.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, macros, and data analysis tools.


Ready to apply your data expertise to make a real impact? Join us and help shape the future of analytics at MFSG. Apply today and let's build the future of MFSG, together.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Red Sun Farms is one of the largest fully vertically integrated, high-tech greenhouse growers in North America. Our seed to plate approach closes the gap between grower, retailer, and consumer; allowing us to develop an exceptional product and an exemplary level of customer service from all our locations, 365 days per year.

¬†

We are currently seeking candidates for the position of Business Data Analyst at our Kingsville Corporate Office.

¬†

The Business Data Analyst, under the direction of the Corporate Controller, will be responsible for performing strategic data analysis across various departments in support of corporate goals and objectives. This role will lead the development of a master data system to reconcile operational, pricing, and cost data across all company locations in Canada, U.S., and Mexico. The Business Data Analyst will ensure the organization is prepared for future audits by implementing robust data controls, performing compliance analysis, and advising on pricing strategies that align with trade regulations. The successful candidate will combine strong attention to detail with a deep understanding of business processes and regulatory compliance to support informed, data-driven strategies across the organization.




What We Offer

Competitive compensation
An incredible work environment
Comprehensive health benefits
Paid vacation time
Defined contribution pension plan
Paid sick days
Employee and Family Assistance Program
Employee Discount Program




Main Responsibilities

Design, implement, and maintain a database to consolidate and reconcile sales and cost data across the Canadian and U.S. distribution business, in collaboration with Mexican operations and related cost of production data
Conduct regular pricing analysis to ensure the organization is optimizing profitability while remaining compliant with applicable regulations
Collaborate with Sales to recommend compliant, data-driven pricing strategies
Optimize and maintain declared values database and supporting calculations to support pro-forma crossing documents for compliance with CBP and CBSA regulations
Analyze financial, operational, and transactional data to identify trends and insights and resolve discrepancies
Demonstrate a high attention to detail with a commitment to data accuracy and integrity, implementing appropriate checks and balances to continually validate outputs
Collaborate with teams across all company locations in Canada, the U.S., and Mexico to collect, analyze, and reconcile data, ensuring alignment across regions
Develop and implement audit-ready controls and documentation to ensure compliance with potential trade audits
Serve as the primary point of contact for trade compliance data across internal teams
Provide audit support and prepare required reports for applicable authorities
Translate complex data sets into clear reports, dashboards, and insights
Provide ad hoc analytical support for special projects, audits, and strategic initiatives

¬†

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, data analytics, finance, mathematics, or a related field required
3-5+ years experience in a Business Analyst, Trade Compliance, or a similar analytical role
Previous experience with regulatory compliance considered an asset
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Office Suite
Previous experience with FAMOUS software considered an asset
Demonstrated ability to work independently and proactively, managing priorities and projects with minimal direction while consistently delivering high-quality results
Exceptional attention to detail, analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities
Direct knowledge of database management and various data retrieval methodologies, including data importing to spreadsheets, graphs, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities




Working Conditions

Work is performed in an office setting
Sitting or standing for an extended amount of time
Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
Ability to attend and conduct presentations
Lifting or moving up to 10lbs may be required
Fast-paced environment
Overtime as required
Travel may be required

¬†

Interested?

Interested candidates are asked to visit www.redsunfarms.com/careers

Title: Senior Product Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Product Data Analyst




Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work¬Æ Institute and recognized as a ‚ÄòCool Vendor‚Äô and a ‚ÄòVendor to Watch‚Äô by Gartner.




Please visit Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination for more information about Fractal.




Position Overview:

Fractal is seeking an experienced and highly influential Senior Product Data Analyst. This is a client facing role where you will be a key strategic partner to product managers, engineers, and designers, using data to shape the future of our client‚Äôs products. You will be responsible for defining and analyzing metrics that measure success, conducting deep-dive analyses to uncover critical insights and opportunities, and driving a culture of data-informed decision-making. The ideal candidate is a master of their craft, possessing deep technical skills combined with strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex data into a compelling narrative that inspires action and drives product strategy.




Roles and Responsibilities:

Strategic Product Partnership:

Act as the primary data science partner for a core product area, influencing product strategy and roadmaps with data-driven insights.
Define and own the key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks to evaluate product performance, user engagement, and the success of new features.
Lead proactive, in-depth analyses to identify and size new opportunities, understand ecosystems, and model the potential impact of product changes.
Translate ambiguous business questions into structured analytical problems, delivering actionable recommendations that drive tangible business outcomes.




Advanced Analytics & Experimentation:

Design, execute, and analyze complex A/B and multivariate tests to optimize user experience, drive growth, and validate product hypotheses.
Develop sophisticated statistical models (e.g., predictive, clustering, causal inference) to understand user behavior, segmentation, and lifetime value.
Conduct deep-dive investigations into user journeys and product funnels to identify pain points and areas for improvement.
Build and maintain robust, automated dashboards and reporting systems to provide visibility into product health and performance for stakeholders at all levels.




Technical Leadership & Mentorship:

Champion data best practices and raise the bar for data quality and analytical rigor across the organization.
Collaborate with Data Engineering to design and build scalable, high-quality data pipelines and data models that support analytical needs.
Mentor junior analysts and other team members, providing guidance on analytical techniques, experimental design, and technical skills.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and broader cross-functional teams, effectively communicating the "so what" behind the data.




Mandatory Technical Skills:

Expert-Level SQL: Demonstrated mastery of SQL for complex querying, data manipulation, and performance optimization across large, complex datasets.
Statistical Programming: High proficiency in a statistical programming language such as Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn) or R.
Data Visualization & BI Tools: Extensive experience creating impactful visualizations and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar.
Experimentation & Statistical Analysis: Deep understanding of experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate testing), statistical significance, and causal inference techniques.
Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling concepts and working with data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).




Mandatory Non-Technical Skills:

Strong Product Sense & Business Acumen: A deep curiosity and ability to understand the "why" behind user behavior and connect data insights to business goals and product strategy.
Exceptional Communication & Storytelling: The ability to distill complex analytical concepts into clear, concise, and compelling narratives for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Leadership & Influence: Proven ability to influence and lead without direct authority, driving consensus and action from cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
Strategic & Critical Thinking: The ability to think strategically, solve ambiguous problems, and move from data to insights to actionable recommendations.
Autonomy & Proactiveness: A self-starter who can manage complex projects from inception to completion with minimal oversight.




Education Qualification and Certifications Required:

Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
5-7+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role with a significant focus on product analytics.
A strong portfolio of projects demonstrates the ability to use data to drive product decisions and business impact.




Pay:

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $80,000 - $140,000 CAD In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus for the current performance period.




Benefits:

As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a ‚Äúfree time‚Äù PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take the time needed for either sick time or vacation.




Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview

BET99 is Canada's Premiere Online Sportsbook and Casino. Launching in 2020, we have consistently innovated the online gaming landscape every step of the way, exponentially growing our customer base and, in turn, our internal BET99 team!




As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of strategic decision-making - turning complex data into insights that drive business success. You bring deep analytical expertise, curiosity to explore complex problems, and a drive to help teams make better decisions. In our fast-paced online sports-book and casino environment, you‚Äôll lead high-impact analytical initiatives, design scalable solutions, and influence how data informs decisions across the business. You‚Äôll also mentor analysts, advocate for data-driven thinking, and contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in challenging the status quo, trust, transparency, integrity, and collaboration.




Responsibilities:

Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define analytical goals, and translate business questions into data solutions.
Apply advanced statistical methods and exploratory analysis to guide strategic decisions in product, marketing, and player engagement
Use Python (and PySpark where appropriate) to clean, transform, and analyze large, complex datasets.
Design and scale dashboards and reporting frameworks in Power BI to support business visibility and planning.
Lead analyses of player behaviour and marketing campaign performance, including segmentation, lifecycle modelling, and retention optimization.
Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract and structure data from various sources.
Communicate findings clearly through strategic recommendations tailored for senior stakeholders.
Define and track core business metrics; design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments.
Mentor junior analysts, contribute to technical development, and uphold quality through code reviews.
Drive automation and scalable reporting solutions to improve efficiency and reliability.
Ensure outputs are accurate, validated, reproducible, and actionable.




Skills and Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in online gaming, sports-book, or digital consumer sectors.
Hands-on experience with marketing analytics, including campaign performance analysis, customer segmentation, and lifecycle insights.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science).
Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques including A/B testing, experimental design, and predictive modelling.
Expertise in SQL and Python; PySpark experience preferred.
Proven experience designing and building effective dashboards in Power BI or equivalent tools.
Familiarity with modern cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).
Strong project ownership and ability to manage multiple complex initiatives.
Experience mentoring team members or leading technical efforts.
Exceptional communication and storytelling skills, especially for non-technical audiences.
High standards of accuracy, integrity, and continuous improvement.

Job Overview

BET99 is Canada's Premiere Online Sportsbook and Casino. Launching in 2020, we have consistently innovated the online gaming landscape every step of the way, exponentially growing our customer base and, in turn, our internal BET99 team!


As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of strategic decision-making - turning complex data into insights that drive business success. You bring deep analytical expertise, curiosity to explore complex problems, and a drive to help teams make better decisions. In our fast-paced online sports-book and casino environment, you‚Äôll lead high-impact analytical initiatives, design scalable solutions, and influence how data informs decisions across the business. You‚Äôll also mentor analysts, advocate for data-driven thinking, and contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in challenging the status quo, trust, transparency, integrity, and collaboration.


Responsibilities:

  • Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define analytical goals, and translate business questions into data solutions.
  • Apply advanced statistical methods and exploratory analysis to guide strategic decisions in product, marketing, and player engagement
  • Use Python (and PySpark where appropriate) to clean, transform, and analyze large, complex datasets.
  • Design and scale dashboards and reporting frameworks in Power BI to support business visibility and planning.
  • Lead analyses of player behaviour and marketing campaign performance, including segmentation, lifecycle modelling, and retention optimization.
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract and structure data from various sources.
  • Communicate findings clearly through strategic recommendations tailored for senior stakeholders.
  • Define and track core business metrics; design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments.
  • Mentor junior analysts, contribute to technical development, and uphold quality through code reviews.
  • Drive automation and scalable reporting solutions to improve efficiency and reliability.
  • Ensure outputs are accurate, validated, reproducible, and actionable.


Skills and Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in online gaming, sports-book, or digital consumer sectors.
  • Hands-on experience with marketing analytics, including campaign performance analysis, customer segmentation, and lifecycle insights.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science).
  • Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques including A/B testing, experimental design, and predictive modelling.
  • Expertise in SQL and Python; PySpark experience preferred.
  • Proven experience designing and building effective dashboards in Power BI or equivalent tools.
  • Familiarity with modern cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).
  • Strong project ownership and ability to manage multiple complex initiatives.
  • Experience mentoring team members or leading technical efforts.
  • Exceptional communication and storytelling skills, especially for non-technical audiences.
  • High standards of accuracy, integrity, and continuous improvement.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, Ecommerce




Overview

We‚Äôre looking for a BI Analyst to build and scale our reporting infrastructure, surface insights that drive strategic decisions, and empower cross-functional teams to work confidently with data. You‚Äôll own the way we track and understand performance in a fast-moving DTC e-commerce environment.




About Jewlr

Personalized Jewelry, designed by you.




At Jewlr, we invite you into a world of possibility, a creative destination to freely discover and design jewelry that is uniquely, and meaningfully yours. Our jewelry is a celebration and a genuine reflection of who you are ‚Äî your beliefs, your loves, your experiences, and your milestones. Explore endless styles and customize to mark your moments, give thoughtfully, and play with personality.




The winner of the 2013 Canada Post's Most Innovative Large Retailer Award, Jewlr's combination of innovative custom design technology with traditional hand made manufacturing delivers high quality jewelry that transforms your memories into timeless pieces.

Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Jewlr was founded in 2009 with the mission to create a truly unique online experience where you choose, personalize, and customize fine jewelry.




Today, Jewlr is an internationally recognized brand employing more than 150 people and has shipped more than 1.5 million orders. Jewlr continues to grow exponentially year-by-year and has redefined the international standard for personalized jewelry.




JOIN OUR TEAM

Ever wanted to be a part of something bigger? We're working towards a fresh new look and want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain core reporting infrastructure in BigQuery and Looker Studio (or similar tools).
Define and own dashboards and reports for KPIs like CVR, AOV, LTV, CAC, retention, and channel performance.
Conduct e-commerce performance analysis by tracking KPIs such as traffic, conversion rates, cart abandonment, AOV, and sales to generate actionable insights.
Regularly produce clear, actionable business insights and reports on e-commerce performance, marketing campaigns, product launches, and customer behavior.
Partner with stakeholders across marketing, merchandising, CX, product, IT, engineering, and executive teams to understand needs and enable self-serve reporting.
Provide documentation and analytical support for Shopify Plus, CMS, ERP, WMS and other systems that support the business.
Design and implement standardized templates and best practices for documenting business processes and performance reporting.
Ensure consistency of metrics definitions and data accuracy across the organization.
Assist with forecasting financial and performance metrics to support strategic planning and goal-setting.
Review and update documentation regularly to maintain accuracy, clarity, and completeness.
Identify and propose improvements to documentation processes to enhance quality and efficiency.
Document data sources, reporting logic, and dashboard usage best practices.




Qualifications & Skills

3‚Äì5+ years of experience in BI, analytics, or data-focused roles, preferably in a DTC or e-commerce setting on Shopify Plus.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data warehouses like BigQuery.
Proficient in BI tools such as Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Proficient in Ecommerce BI tools such as Triple Whale, Polar Analytics and Elevar.
Solid understanding of standard e-commerce KPIs and how to track them effectively.
Strong communication skills and the ability to turn complex data into simple business narratives.
Self-starter with the ability to proactively identify opportunities and deliver solutions.




This is a full-time hybrid position based in Toronto.




Jewlr is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion and

providing a workplace that is free from discrimination. Jewlr is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. Such accommodation is available on request in respect of all aspects of the recruitment, assessment and selection process and may be requested by emailing help@jewlr.com.

Title: Principal Data Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

Position Overview

Autodesk has invested in data-driven decision-making, optimizing our platform‚Äôs business, product, and cost. The next five years will transform how we work, with a surge in data volume and scaling of AI/ML to provide even greater value to our customers. We are looking for a Principal Data Analyst to join Autodesk‚Äôs Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies organization on this transformative journey and to drive data-informed decision-making through advanced data analytics and insights.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization. This role reports to the Sr. Manager, Data Analytics.

Preference for candidates to work hybrid/remote from Toronto or Montreal offices.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
Proactively mine for data drive insights to support PSET's platform initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact
Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed
Mentor and support junior analysts by providing technical guidance, sharing best practices, and fostering a culture of continuous learning within the team


Minimum Qualifications


8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling. Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
Familiarity with Autodesk‚Äôs product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline

Title: Data & AI Governance Analyst
Description:
Position Summary:

Airswift is working with one of our major clients in the Oil & Gas industry to find a detail-oriented and proactive Data & AI Governance Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in establishing and maintaining data governance policies, ensuring data quality, compliance, and proper data management practices across the organization. This role requires collaboration with various business units to support data stewardship and regulatory requirements.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in Information Management, Data Science, Business, or related field.

- 5+ years of experience in data governance, data management, or related roles.

- Strong understanding of data & AI governance frameworks and best practices.

- Familiarity with data privacy laws and regulations.

- Experience with data quality tools and metadata management is a plus.

- Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work collaboratively across cross-functional teams.




Preferred Skills:

- Knowledge of reporting tools (e.g. Power BI)

- Experience with Databricks

- Knowledge of SAP

- Certification in data governance (e.g., DGSP) is an advantage.

Key Responsibilities:

- Support Enterprise Data & AI Governance Framework - Contribute to the development, maintenance, and communication of data and AI standards, policies, and procedures, including the creation and upkeep of the business glossary to ensure clarity and consistency, while maintaining adherence to regulatory requirements and organizational objectives.

- Enable and Support Data Stewardship - Onboard, train, and guide Data Stewards on DQ concepts, tools, and governance best practices, fostering cross-functional collaboration and knowledge sharing.

- Implement and Maintain Data Quality Framework - Support the setup, execution, and ongoing optimization of data quality processes across business domains, ensuring alignment with enterprise data governance standards.

- Define and Manage Critical Data Elements (CDEs) - Collaborate with domain data stewards to identify, document, and operationalize CDEs in line with governance, compliance, and business priorities.

- Develop and Optimize DQ Rules and Queries - Design, review, and refine data quality rules, queries, and improvement plans to ensure accurate, consistent, and reliable data across systems.

- Build and Manage Data Quality Dashboards - Create and maintain dashboards to monitor data health, track KPIs, and provide actionable insights for business and technical stakeholders.

- Document Processes and Maintain SharePoint Resources - Create, update, and organize process documentation, user guides, and governance assets within SharePoint to ensure centralized, easy access for stakeholders.

- Data and AI literacy - Assist with designing and delivering targeted training, resources, and communications that enhance understanding of data governance principles and the responsible use of AI across diverse user groups.

Title: Data & AI Governance Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data & AI Governance Analyst for a 12-month contract position, with possible extensions in Calgary, Alberta. Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.




This position is 100% onsite in downtown Calgary. 8 hours a day, 40 hours a week. It is NOT a remote role.




Role Description

The ideal candidate will play a key role in establishing and maintaining data governance policies, ensuring data quality, compliance, and proper data management practices across the organization. This role requires collaboration with various business units to support data stewardship and regulatory requirements




Responsibilities

Support Enterprise Data & AI Governance Framework ‚Äì Contribute to the development, maintenance, and communication of data and AI standards, policies, and procedures, including the creation and upkeep of the business glossary to ensure clarity and consistency, while maintaining adherence to regulatory requirements and organizational objectives.
Enable and Support Data Stewardship ‚Äì Onboard, train, and guide Data Stewards on DQ concepts, tools, and governance best practices, fostering cross-functional collaboration and knowledge sharing.
Implement and Maintain Data Quality Framework ‚Äì Support the setup, execution, and ongoing optimization of data quality processes across business domains, ensuring alignment with enterprise data governance standards.
Define and Manage Critical Data Elements (CDEs) ‚Äì Collaborate with domain data stewards to identify, document, and operationalize CDEs in line with governance, compliance, and business priorities.
Develop and Optimize DQ Rules and Queries ‚Äì Design, review, and refine data quality rules, queries, and improvement plans to ensure accurate, consistent, and reliable data across systems.
Build and Manage Data Quality Dashboards ‚Äì Create and maintain dashboards to monitor data health, track KPIs, and provide actionable insights for business and technical stakeholders.
Document Processes and Maintain SharePoint Resources ‚Äì Create, update, and organize process documentation, user guides, and governance assets within SharePoint to ensure centralized, easy access for stakeholders.
Data and AI literacy ‚Äì Assist with designing and delivering targeted training, resources, and communications that enhance understanding of data governance principles and the responsible use of AI across diverse user groups.




Required Skills and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Management, Data Science, Business, or related field.
5+ years of experience in data governance, data management, or related roles.
Strong understanding of data & AI governance frameworks and best practices.
Familiarity with data privacy laws and regulations.
Experience with data quality tools and metadata management is a plus.
Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively across cross-functional teams.




Desired Skills and Experience

Knowledge of reporting tools (e.g. PowerBI)
Experience with Databricks
Knowledge of SAP
Certification in data governance (e.g., DGSP) is an advantage.







Please note that while all applications are appreciated, only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Level Access is the category leader in digital accessibility, combining SaaS and professional services to help organizations make the digital world more inclusive! With over $100M in ARR and growing, we serve global enterprise and public sector customers with critically important solutions. As we scale to meet ambitious goals in North America, the public sector, and European markets, we‚Äôre investing in the kind of world-class marketing organization that can drive this growth!

We‚Äôre seeking a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about data, storytelling, and operational excellence. This is a pivotal role responsible for marketing analytics and reporting across all channels and programs. You will be the go-to expert on marketing performance data‚Äîhelping us understand what‚Äôs working, what‚Äôs not, and where to invest to maximize return on investment.

You‚Äôll work multi-functionally with partners in Marketing, Revenue Operations, and Systems, and be trusted to turn complex data into clear insights that fuel decision-making and pipeline acceleration.

Role and Responsibilities


Own the end-to-end development of marketing dashboards and reporting across campaigns, programs, channels, funnel stages, and pipeline creation
Build and maintain SQL-based datasets and reports from Salesforce, HubSpot, and Google Analytics
Analyze marketing performance metrics (e.g., lead generation, conversion rates, channel attribution, ROMI) and deliver actionable insights
Partner with Revenue Operations and Marketing stakeholders to support pipeline planning, forecasting, and coverage analysis
Identify data gaps and opportunities to improve reporting processes, data integrity, and automation
Drive a culture of measurement and optimization within the marketing org


Qualifications


2‚Äì4 years of experience in marketing analytics, business intelligence, or marketing operations, ideally in a B2B SaaS environment
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI, QuickSight, or similar)
Deep understanding of marketing funnels, pipeline development, and performance metrics
Experience working with Salesforce CRM; familiarity with Hubspot and Google Analytics a plus
Demonstrable ability to translate data into clear insights and compelling narratives for stakeholders
Thorough, self-motivated, and adaptable to a fast-paced environment


Nice to Have


Familiarity with marketing attribution modeling or campaign influence frameworks
Experience supporting public sector or international marketing initiatives
Background in professional services, enterprise sales, or account-based marketing analytics


Application Process

This is a full-time salaried position with a competitive benefits package, including bonus opportunities and unlimited vacation/FTO. Salary is commensurate with experience.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Reporting to the Manager, Occupational Health, Safety and Wellness (OHSW), the Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting data to support evidence-based decision making, improve workplace health and safety outcomes, and enhance wellness initiatives. Designing, develop and maintain interactive dashboards to monitor and report Occupational Health, Safety & Wellness metrics. Working closely with internal and external partners, the Data Analyst will identify trends, measure program effectiveness, and develop actionable insights to reduce workplace risks, optimize resources and promote a healthy, safe and engaged workforce. The Data Analyst will have strong analytical skills, a collaborative mindset and a passion for leveraging data to promote a culture of health, safety and wellbeing amongst the MGH community.

Primary Responsibilities


Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, clean, and analyze occupational health, safety, and wellness data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Data Reporting & Communication: Design and create automated reports anddashboards to provide ongoing visibility into performance metrics, quality outcomes, and OHSW KPIs. Prepare clear, visually engaging reports and presentations that communicate findings, trends, and recommendations to leadership, committees, and other stakeholders to support informed decision-making.
Dashboard Development: Build and maintain interactive dashboards to monitor program performance, track trends, and enable real-time data access for stakeholders.
Program Evaluation: Measure and assess the effectiveness of safety, health, and wellness initiatives, providing data-driven insights and recommendations for improvement.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with OHSW leaders, operational teams, and other partners to define data needs, establish reporting standards, and ensure alignment with organizational priorities.
Data Governance: Maintain data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant privacy and health information regulations.


EDUCATION


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Public Health, or a related field; an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.


Qualifications


Minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in data analysis, preferably within occupational health, safety, wellness, or a related healthcare/organizational setting.


Technical Skills


Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and other data manipulation tools.
Experience with automated reporting and dashboard development.


Analytical Skills: Proven ability to analyze complex datasets, identify trends, and translate findings into actionable insights.


Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present data clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work effectively withcross-functional teams and build strong stakeholder relationships.


Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and commitment to data quality, integrity, and security.


Knowledge: Familiarity with occupational health, safety, wellness principles, and relevant privacy legislation (e.g., PHIPA, HIPAA) is an asset.


Good work and attendance record required.
All employees of Michael Garron Hospital (MGH), a division of Toronto East Health Network (TEHN) [formerly Toronto EastGeneral Hospital (TEGH)] agree to work within the legislated practices of the Occupational Health and Safety Act of Ontario.
All employees of MGH are responsible to contribute to a transparent culture of patient and staff safety by adhering to and abiding by patientand staff safety policies and procedures set by MGH.
All employees are accountable for protecting the psychological health and safety of themselves and their co-workers through adherence to MGH's policies and practices.

The Data Analyst will have strong analytical skills, a collaborative mindset and a passion for leveraging data to promote a culture of health, safety and wellbeing amongst the MGH community.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, clean, and analyze occupational health, safety, and wellness data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
  • Data Reporting & Communication: Design and create automated reports anddashboards to provide ongoing visibility into performance metrics, quality outcomes, and OHSW KPIs. Prepare clear, visually engaging reports and presentations that communicate findings, trends, and recommendations to leadership, committees, and other stakeholders to support informed decision-making.
  • Dashboard Development: Build and maintain interactive dashboards to monitor program performance, track trends, and enable real-time data access for stakeholders.
  • Program Evaluation: Measure and assess the effectiveness of safety, health, and wellness initiatives, providing data-driven insights and recommendations for improvement.
  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with OHSW leaders, operational teams, and other partners to define data needs, establish reporting standards, and ensure alignment with organizational priorities.
  • Data Governance: Maintain data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant privacy and health information regulations.

EDUCATION

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Public Health, or a related field; an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in data analysis, preferably within occupational health, safety, wellness, or a related healthcare/organizational setting.

Technical Skills

  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
  • Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and other data manipulation tools.
  • Experience with automated reporting and dashboard development.

Analytical Skills: Proven ability to analyze complex datasets, identify trends, and translate findings into actionable insights.

  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present data clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work effectively withcross-functional teams and build strong stakeholder relationships.

  • Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and commitment to data quality, integrity, and security.

Knowledge: Familiarity with occupational health, safety, wellness principles, and relevant privacy legislation (e.g., PHIPA, HIPAA) is an asset.

  • Good work and attendance record required.
  • All employees of Michael Garron Hospital (MGH), a division of Toronto East Health Network (TEHN) [formerly Toronto EastGeneral Hospital (TEGH)] agree to work within the legislated practices of the Occupational Health and Safety Act of Ontario.
  • All employees of MGH are responsible to contribute to a transparent culture of patient and staff safety by adhering to and abiding by patientand staff safety policies and procedures set by MGH.
  • All employees are accountable for protecting the psychological health and safety of themselves and their co-workers through adherence to MGH's policies and practices.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Insight Global is seeking a Sr. Data Analyst for one of Canada's top insurance companies. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will contribute by working on complex data analysis projects while also supporting your team through coaching on the use of data analytics. You will demonstrate critical judgment in determining how a business objective can be addressed and decompose complex problems or high-level business objectives into smaller problems that can be solved using data analytics.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- 5+ years experience in BI or a related field

- Strong understanding of data analysis, programming/tools, data warehouse/data management, and data modeling

- Experience in end-to-end production implementation process for analytical solutions

- Power BI or MicroStrategy

- Excellent communication skills

NICE TO HAVE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Microsoft Power Platform or PowerApps

- Insurance experience

Title: Data Analyst / Analyste de Donn√©es
Description:
UNCAGE YOUR AMBITION as a

Quality Assurance & Data Analyst

We are FlightHub Group, an ambitious team of people that created FlightHub and Justfly. Our brands have grown to become two of the top-ranked travel agencies in North America. We now serve over 3 million customers per year, totaling 3 billion dollars in sales, and, whereas the pandemic may have slowed us down a little, we are coming back even stronger. We dream big, pursue passionately, and follow through with resolute self-belief and rigorous commitment. We are a group of individuals sharing a common vision and values, having come together to pursue a collective mission: overtaking the #1 spot in the world.

We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our Airline & Supplier Relations team, which manages strategic partnerships, agreements, and incentive programs. This role will focus on ensuring data accuracy and reporting reliability across backends, bookings, cancellations, and financial alignment, while supporting strategic growth initiatives with our airline partners.

Key Responsibilities


Interpret and analyze airline contracts to extract key terms
Generate airline incentive reports on a daily basis
Deliver monthly summary reports to Finance for reconciliation and incentive validation
Conduct manual quality assurance checks on booking data to ensure accuracy and compliance with agreements
Ensure the timely and accurate contract entry, in accordance with established procedures
Develop, test, and refine AI prompts to improve data accuracy and operational efficiency
Identify patterns in partner performance and revenue drivers; recommend actionable optimization strategies
Maintain data documentation and tracking systems to ensure consistent reporting and insight generation


Qualifications


1‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or business intelligence (airline/travel industry experience is a strong plus)
Proficiency in SQL for extracting and validating data across multiple sources
Strong skills in Google Sheets / Excel (pivot tables, advanced formulas, visualizations)
Proven ability to reconcile operational and financial data with a high degree of accuracy
Familiarity with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, or Power BI) is a plus


Soft Skills


Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy
Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking ability
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks
Please note this position is in Montreal, Quebec and on-site.


Show us your drive and join our team!

Title: Analyst, Cancer Registry
Description:
Pour obtenir une traduction en fran√ßais de l‚Äôoffre d‚Äôemploi suivante, veuillez envoyer un courriel √† careers@ontariohealth.ca. Les demandes seront trait√©es dans un d√©lai de trois jours ouvrables et la p√©riode de d√©p√¥t des demandes sera prolong√©e de trois jours.

To obtain a French translation of the following job posting, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca. Requests will be addressed within three business days, and the application window will be extended by three business days.

At Ontario Health, we are committed to developing a strong organizational culture that connects and inspires all team members across the province. Our vision is that together, we will be a leader in health and wellness for all. Our mission is to connect the health system to drive improved and equitable health outcomes, experiences and value. How we work together is reflected through our five values: integrity, inspiration, tenacity, humility and care.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

What Ontario Health offers:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Achieving your career goals is a priority to us. Benefits of working at Ontario Health may include the following based on employment type:‚ÄØ


Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage from your first day‚ÄØ
a health care spending or wellness spending account
a premium defined benefit pension plan‚ÄØ
three personal days and two float days annually‚ÄØ
three weeks‚Äô vacation to start (for individual contributors), increasing to four weeks after two years
career development opportunities‚ÄØ
a collaborative values-based team culture‚ÄØ
a wellness program
a hybrid working model‚ÄØ
participation in Communities of Inclusion‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


Want to make a difference in your career? ‚ÄØConsider this opportunity.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

As an essential member of the Ontario Cancer Registry, operated by Ontario Health (Cancer Care Ontario), the cancer registry analyst will work to create cancer patient data utilizing healthcare facility-based patient records, electronic synoptic pathology reports and other provincial cancer related data holdings. The primary responsibilities of the cancer registry analyst are to assure that complete and accurate cancer data is generated, collected, analysed and maintained for all Ontario residents diagnosed with cancer. The cancer registry analyst will work with members of various Ontario Health research and analytic teams and technology services as well as external healthcare providers, health information management leads, privacy officers and information technology contacts in the daily course of their work.

Here Is What You Will Be Doing

Cancer registry operations support


Retrieve, undertake critical review and amend as necessary, cases of resolved cancer using an electronic editing interface
Conduct this work in compliance with internationally established rules and guidelines as set out by World Health Organization International Classification of Diseases- Oncology (ICD-O) and NCI/SEER (National Cancer Institute/Surveillance Epidemiology End Results Solid Tumor Rules), all as coordinated by the North American Association of Central Cancer Registries (NAACCR) and nationally adopted by the Canadian Council of Cancer Registries (CCCR). The CCCR sets the data standards for surveillance cancer registries that report to the Canadian Cancer Registry administered by Statistics Canada
Conduct this work in a timely manner
Participate in audits of cancer registry data, and of the user interface
Work somewhat independently with supervision following established policies and procedures
Demonstrate methodical problem-solving skills and techniques


Pathology report coding


Retrieve, review, and classify electronic pathology reports for all OCR reportable diseases, distinguishing between them and non-reportable diagnoses
Enter demographics into a manual interface, review and classify paper-based pathology reports as above
Complete routine disease classification of reports in a timely manner
Perform quality assessments as required or ePath content and format
Perform UAT and quality assessment of ePath tools, or their upgrades or enhancements
Participate in audits of the reports‚Äô medical content as required for Clinical Services or Surveillance
Responsible for following and adhering to corporate and departmental policy/procedures and standards


Manual case review


Retrieve, review and amend cases of resolved cancer from the EDW-OCR via a web-based application
Perform evaluation of resolved cancer cases based on understanding of North American standards for cancer registration as well as Ontario specific data sources
Communicate technical and report related problems to Team Lead or IT support
Participate in quality assurance or research activities as required
Participate in evaluation of Resolink application as required, including ‚Äútroubleshooting‚Äù and UAT
Participate in ad hoc case review in support of research studies and conduct specialized data collection


Patient linkage


Review of deterministic linkage results for the EDW
Resolution of grey area record pairs for the EDW
Review of weights and thresholds used in linkages as directed
Navigate ResoLink for Linkage (EDW); review persons, all source records and any resolved cancer cases in order to correct linkage defects
Work with the IT and EDW teams to resolve issues related to linkage
Work with Ontario Cancer Registry staff after the annual CCR-STC (Canadian Cancer Registry-Statistics Canada) data submission to resolve errors on persons or cases identified by STC
Conduct the STC annual national death clearance
Conduct the STC annual national record linkage
Maintain patient/disease listings for Nunavut as directed


Cancer staging


Retrieve, review, and interpret cancer information in patient records for the purpose of staging cancer cases as required by the Ontario Cancer Registry utilizing electronic data collection software
Stage cancer cases in compliance with internationally established rules and guidelines as set out by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) TNM staging classification, SEER SSDI and Grade manuals and the American College of Surgeons Standards for Oncology Registry Entry (STORE) manual.
Apply ICD-O codes and SEER Solid Tumor Rules to each staged case
Manage remote access accounts with multiple hospital electronic health record systems in keeping with data security and privacy agreements
Conduct this work in compliance with Ontario Cancer Registry productivity and data quality standards
Participate in data quality audits of cancer registry data, and user acceptance testing of data collection software
Must maintain subject matter expertise by attending mandatory continuing education
Work independently following established policies and procedures
Demonstrate methodical problem-solving skills and techniques
Exhibit collaboration and consultation with peers


Education And Experience

Here is what you will need to be successful:


Certification as a Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) as designated by the National Cancer Registrar Association (preferred), OR
Certification in Health Information Management (CHIM) as designated by the Canadian College of Health Information, OR
Completion of a healthcare related College Diploma or Bachelor‚Äôs degree, with an agreement to pursue the CTR credential upon hiring.
2-4 years of cancer registry experience preferred.
Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Teams.


Knowledge And Skills


Extensive knowledge of medical terminology and anatomy & physiology.
Well versed in navigation of electronic health records and clinical chart review.
Familiar with data collection software and data abstraction principles.
Working knowledge of privacy legislation and ethical practices in the handling of personal health information.
Able to take initiative as required.


Location: GTA, Ontario

Employment Type

Temporary + (Fixed Term) Full time

Contract Length

12 Month(s)

Salary Band

Band 4

External Application Deadline Date

August 25, 2025

All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.

Ontario Health encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, M√©tis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; members of Black and racialized groups; 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary individuals; and people living with disabilities.

Ontario Health is an accessible employer, and we offer accommodation in all aspects of employment, including the recruitment process. If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca and a member of the team will connect with you within 48 hours.

  • Apply ICD-O codes and SEER Solid Tumor Rules to each staged case
  • Manage remote access accounts with multiple hospital electronic health record systems in keeping with data security and privacy agreements
  • Conduct this work in compliance with Ontario Cancer Registry productivity and data quality standards
  • Participate in data quality audits of cancer registry data, and user acceptance testing of data collection software
  • Must maintain subject matter expertise by attending mandatory continuing education
  • Work independently following established policies and procedures
  • Demonstrate methodical problem-solving skills and techniques
  • Exhibit collaboration and consultation with peers

Education And Experience

Here is what you will need to be successful:

  • Certification as a Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) as designated by the National Cancer Registrar Association (preferred), OR
  • Certification in Health Information Management (CHIM) as designated by the Canadian College of Health Information, OR
  • Completion of a healthcare related College Diploma or Bachelor‚Äôs degree, with an agreement to pursue the CTR credential upon hiring.
  • 2-4 years of cancer registry experience preferred.
  • Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Teams.

Knowledge And Skills

  • Extensive knowledge of medical terminology and anatomy & physiology.
  • Well versed in navigation of electronic health records and clinical chart review.
  • Familiar with data collection software and data abstraction principles.
  • Working knowledge of privacy legislation and ethical practices in the handling of personal health information.
  • Able to take initiative as required.

Location: GTA, Ontario

Employment Type

Temporary + (Fixed Term) Full time

Contract Length

12 Month(s)

Salary Band

Band 4

External Application Deadline Date

August 25, 2025

All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.

Ontario Health encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, M√©tis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; members of Black and racialized groups; 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary individuals; and people living with disabilities.

Ontario Health is an accessible employer, and we offer accommodation in all aspects of employment, including the recruitment process. If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca and a member of the team will connect with you within 48 hours.

Title: Analyst, Data and Analytics, Temporary full-time
Description:
Temporary Full Time

We are looking for an Analyst Data & Analytics on a temporary full-time basis for 12-months.

As an Analyst Data & Analytics, you will join Canada Life‚Äôs Canada Operations & Business Enablement, Data Analytics and Reporting team. In this role you will support all Canada Operations teams with the development, implementation, and maintenance of analytics solutions ranging from descriptive and diagnostic to predictive.

The Analyst, Data & Analytics supports decision making, monitors business performance, and provides actionable insights using analytics and statistical techniques.

In this role, you will assist in modelling, analysing, and predicting business processes. You will translate business requirements into data, reporting, and analytics projects, which you will support throughout their entire lifecycle.

This position requires the successful candidate to obtain Reliability Status security clearance. This is a personnel security status that is required before an employee can gain access to‚ÄØProtected B‚ÄØinformation, assets or work sites as outlined by the Government of Canada website.

What you will do:


Translate business needs into data requirements, collect, integrate, clean, explore, model, and analyze large datasets and visualize results and present to business leaders
Build, implement and maintain data models, custom reports, and dashboards
Work with large datasets that are not consistent, clean, or fully modelled
Communicate effectively and demonstrate critical thinking and business acumen.
Define, implement, and monitor metrics and KPIs and ensure ongoing strategic alignment with short and long-term business objectives
Enable effective, efficient working relationships with business partners
Work closely with senior leaders to understand business drivers and enable them to make decisions based on data
Support projects throughout the entire analytics lifecycle
Present and communicate insights and recommendations in a visual and simplified manner


What you will bring:


1-3 years of relevant experience and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field of study, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate (PL-300) certification is preferred
Demonstrated experience in working with data analytics tools (SQL, Python), Databases (SQL Server), Cloud (Azure, Databricks), data visualisation tools (Power BI) with experience at creating interactive dashboards
Ability to write efficient SQL and Python queries to extract, integrate, and transform data from multiple sources, and to automate data pipelines
Proficiency in Power BI, Data Modelling, Power Query, and DAX
Experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets
Good knowledge in data analytics and statistical modelling
Strong communication and presentation skills
Proven ability to learn quickly and independently and handle multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
Experience within the Financial Services sector would be an asset


The base salary for this position is between $52,800.00 - $97,700.00 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You‚Äôre part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you‚Äôll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It‚Äôs our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that‚Äôs trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves‚ÄØthe financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we‚Äôre one of Canada‚Äôs leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.‚ÄØ

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee‚ÄØhas the opportunity to‚ÄØreach their potential.‚ÄØ

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com.

Canada Life‚ÄØwould like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Canada.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Canada for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Remote ~ Work From Home ~ WFH ~ Telecommuting ~ Freelance

Title: Digital Analytics Consulting
Description:
We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our team.

Requirements:


Analyzing website traffic, user behaviour, and campaign performance to provide actionable insights and recommendations
Experience using web analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), data visualization tools, and potentially programming languages like Python
Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions
Collaborate with clients to understand their objectives, develop measurement strategies, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and optimize online presence.
Providing recommendations for improving website usability, optimizing marketing campaigns, and enhancing overall online presence
Assist with the implementation of tracking code, customizing analytics solutions, and ensuring data accuracy
Create reports to communicate findings to clients and stakeholders, highlighting key trends and insights
Ability to identify issues and propose solutions.


Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree
3-5 years of relevant digital marketing experience
Agency experience is an asset
Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal and the ability to collaborate with a cross functional team in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
Ability to multitask and complete deadlines in a fast-paced, challenging environment
